We are asking our community of friends and supporters to help us make history, help create an unforgettable experience for New York City, and help bring a singular and engaging piece of music to life. By contributing to this campaign you will be funding the composers who are writing these works, the rental of a professional sound system and personnel, instrument rental, music stands, chairs, and tents for the kids and their instruments.
With your donations, you can receive:



CD/download of the live performance

Tshirt and a printed event poster
signed copy of the score
invitation to exclusive party at a SoHo loft
dinner at a SoHo restaurant
private concert for you and your friends
and more!


    The Impact The direct benefits of contributing to the creation of a new piece of classical music, beyond enjoying the performance, are perhaps not as tangible as, say, donating to a campaign to create a new, more amazing watch. But for classical music itself, support from individuals to create new works is vital. Without the financial support of people throughout the ages, we would not have many of the great works that define the western musical canon.
The creation of new works in the classical field is what keeps the genre vibrant. It is what injects new life into an old art form.
In the Concerto for Buildings, there is the added benefit of bringing to life a new piece of classical music performed by youth ensembles. 
Literally nowhere else in the world are there not one, but two contemporary ensembles for kids focused completely on the creation and performance of new classical music. We are fortunate to live in such a place as New York City. The students in these two groups are equally fortunate to have the opportunity to work on complex music written by living composers — and more often than not, to learn from them directly. 
This new work will not only give the students the opportunity to work directly with high-level composers, but it will give the students, as their director Jenny Undercofler says, "a little secret access to get do something they wouldn't get to do otherwise... because who gets to drum on buildings!"
As well, for all three organizations — Make Music New York, Face The Music, and Mantra Youth Percussion — this will be the first major commission the groups have been able to undertake, either individually or collectively. Undercofler explains that Face The Music does not get the chance to commission music, largely for financial reasons, so "for us to participate in a collective commissioning project is exciting because it allows us to access new work by grown-up composers, that's brand new work and that is something we don't get to do enough of!"
Thank you for reading about our project! Please consider supporting it and perhaps as importantly... please, please share our campaign on social media. The more eyes that can view this campaign, the better!
Many, many thanks.
The Make Music New York Team!

story:
Dandelions? Oh, well...

  • My name is Iordache. I am a jazz and rock saxophone player and composer living in Bucharest, Romania. I have played and recorded with some of Romania's best bands and musicians. Currently I am leading my own jazz funk quartet, Iordache, and I'm playing with indie rock band Kumm. I recorded about 30 albums, including 5 under my own name. This is the 6th.
  • I had the idea of this particular project with plants a few years ago, in Germany, while trying to do something interesting with my friend and bassist Utu Pascu, while the van of our rock band Kumm was being repaired.
  • In Romania, most city kids have relatives in the countryside, so we both knew how to extract sound from dandelions. (As for playing the leaf, there are bona fide virtuosos of it on the folk music scene here. I don't even come close to these masters.) Utu recorded what we had played then, but the recording was lost.
  • Last spring, I noticed the dandelions in full bloom and remembered the whole thing. I set up to record an album of them. At first I thought it would be something to do during the weekend, but I ended up recording and mixing the whole thing for more than a month.
  • I decided, from the start, that I wouldn't compose anything beforehand. Each dandelion has its own sound and feel, which depends on its age, whether it grew in the sun or in the shadow, whether it rained in the last few days or not and probably other things I have no idea about. The same goes for the leaves. Since they are very unpredictable (they split and break) after a few attempts to record full tracks I decided I would work like they do in electronic music. That is, I would sample and loop and then record some more, until I felt the song was ready. Every tune  started with an improvised line based on what the plant wanted to sound like, so I might say they did half my job!
  • When you pre-order this weirdness, you will have contributed to the first jazz (or jazz related) album recorded with plants. Is it important? Well, I have no clue, so it's up to you to decide. What I do know is only that it was a lot of fun to make, and it opened my own ears to a whole new world of between-the-cracks pitches and melodies I wouldn't have thought of otherwise.

The music has already been recorded - listen! What next?

I recorded the music at my home, so there were no studio costs. I also did some pre-mixing.

  • The album was then professionally mixed in a studio, in Bucharest. Cost: $600.
  • The cover photography and design were made by Medicine Madison. The inside layout and full graphic design will be also made by her. The cost for everything: $600
  • The CD will be a "digifile" - just like a 4-panel Digipak, except for the plastic tray on the right. I found it stupid to make an album glorifying nature, only to have some useless plastic packaging it. It would be with us for the next three hundred years. So it's just good quality cardboard, with gloss UV coating. No plastic except for the CD itself. Production cost: $800 for the first 300 copies.
  • The album will be officially released in January or February 2008, with a contemporary dance show created by choreographer Andreea Novac, in Bucharest. Estimated costs for the show and the promotional campaign for the album: $1800.  The show will only happen if I reach my goal, or come fairly close to it. Otherwise, the extra money will be invested in promoting the album.
  • The album will be released by my own label, Fiver House Records. If this goes well, I will adopt it as a model for other albums I will release in the future. If the goal is not met, all the digital-related perks will still stand, and a sufficient number of CD's will be made for those who pre-ordered them.

The Impact

  • This project will change the way you look at dandelions forever. For those interested, I will post a video on how to make a dandelion into a double reed instrument in seconds, then extract melodies out of it. Thus, everybody will be able to make their own music with dandelions and leaves. There are worse things one can do.
  • On the other hand, this will encourage me to keep doing experimental projects.

Risks & Challenges

There are no risks, except for the contemporary dance show - which is very important for me. My campaign runs until December 26. So the only risk, for those of you who don't move fast enough, is to get your CD after Christmas - especially for those outside Romania - shipping time will have to be considered.
But you want it for Christmas, right?

"Sounds fun, but I cannot afford this right now..."

No problem:

  • Please share it on your favorite social media, tell your friends who might appreciate weird music, make a paper plane and think about me.

Currently I am leading my own jazz funk quartet, Iordache, and I'm playing with indie rock band Kumm. I recorded about 30 albums, including 5 under my own name. This is the 6th.
I had the idea of this particular project with plants a few years ago, in Germany, while trying to do something interesting with my friend and bassist Utu Pascu, while the van of our rock band Kumm was being repaired.
In Romania, most city kids have relatives in the countryside, so we both knew how to extract sound from dandelions. (As for playing the leaf, there are bona fide virtuosos of it on the folk music scene here. I don't even come close to these masters.) Utu recorded what we had played then, but the recording was lost.
Last spring, I noticed the dandelions in full bloom and remembered the whole thing. I set up to record an album of them. At first I thought it would be something to do during the weekend, but I ended up recording and mixing the whole thing for more than a month.
I decided, from the start, that I wouldn't compose anything beforehand. Each dandelion has its own sound and feel, which depends on its age, whether it grew in the sun or in the shadow, whether it rained in the last few days or not and probably other things I have no idea about. The same goes for the leaves. Since they are very unpredictable (they split and break) after a few attempts to record full tracks I decided I would work like they do in electronic music. That is, I would sample and loop and then record some more, until I felt the song was ready. Every tune  started with an improvised line based on what the plant wanted to sound like, so I might say they did half my job!
When you pre-order this weirdness, you will have contributed to the first jazz (or jazz related) album recorded with plants. Is it important? Well, I have no clue, so it's up to you to decide. What I do know is only that it was a lot of fun to make, and it opened my own ears to a whole new world of between-the-cracks pitches and melodies I wouldn't have thought of otherwise.

I recorded the music at my home, so there were no studio costs. I also did some pre-mixing.

The album was then professionally mixed in a studio, in Bucharest. Cost: $600.
The cover photography and design were made by Medicine Madison. The inside layout and full graphic design will be also made by her. The cost for everything: $600
The CD will be a "digifile" - just like a 4-panel Digipak, except for the plastic tray on the right. I found it stupid to make an album glorifying nature, only to have some useless plastic packaging it. It would be with us for the next three hundred years. So it's just good quality cardboard, with gloss UV coating. No plastic except for the CD itself. Production cost: $800 for the first 300 copies.
The album will be officially released in January or February 2008, with a contemporary dance show created by choreographer Andreea Novac, in Bucharest. Estimated costs for the show and the promotional campaign for the album: $1800.  The show will only happen if I reach my goal, or come fairly close to it. Otherwise, the extra money will be invested in promoting the album.
The album will be released by my own label, Fiver House Records. If this goes well, I will adopt it as a model for other albums I will release in the future. If the goal is not met, all the digital-related perks will still stand, and a sufficient number of CD's will be made for those who pre-ordered them.


The Impact

This project will change the way you look at dandelions forever. For those interested, I will post a video on how to make a dandelion into a double reed instrument in seconds, then extract melodies out of it. Thus, everybody will be able to make their own music with dandelions and leaves. There are worse things one can do.
On the other hand, this will encourage me to keep doing experimental projects.


Risks & Challenges
There are no risks, except for the contemporary dance show - which is very important for me. My campaign runs until December 26. So the only risk, for those of you who don't move fast enough, is to get your CD after Christmas - especially for those outside Romania - shipping time will have to be considered.But you want it for Christmas, right?

"Sounds fun, but I cannot afford this right now..."
No problem:
Please share it on your favorite social media, tell your friends who might appreciate weird music, make a paper plane and think about me.

story:
My name is Jack Lenz and I want to share an opportunity with you to help realize a project that I have dreamed and planned on doing for several years.  In 1982, I wrote a series of children’s songs called, “We are Baha’is” and one of those songs was called, “Song of the Months”. I wrote that song for an international Baha’i Conference in Montreal and set the names of the months in English and Arabic to music. The song had kind of a Caribbean feel and was a way of teaching my children (and myself) the names of the months and the order they appear in as part of the Badi Calendar.

Listen to 'Song of the Months' Here

When I worked on the 2nd Baha’i World Congress in 1992, one of the songs was “The Garden of Ridvan”. Jimmy Seals had written a melody and lyric about the Blessed Beauty as we had previously discussed doing this project at that time and wanted to write and produce a song for each Baha’i Feast and each Holy Day. He and Kingsley Thurber and I co-wrote the “Garden of Ridvan” and so we incorporated the Feast of Beauty idea into that song that was part of the Oratorio at The 2nd Baha’i World Congress. So finally, in 2017, I started to write this collection of songs to honour each of the Baha’i Feasts and Holy Days and make recordings of each of these songs with a great choir and musicians.

 

The Badi Calendar

The Badi Calendar is a new and universal way in which humans will measure time for centuries to come.   It was originated by a young Persian Prophet called The Bab (The Gate), whose message of the approaching maturity of the human race was announced on May 23rd, 1844, the day before the first telegraph message was sent by Samuel Morse to Alfred Vail from Washington to Baltimore and back saying, “What hath God wrought?”

This calendar was subsequently ratified by Baha’u’llah, the Manifestation of God who succeeded The Bab, who had been murdered in 1850 by Muhammad Shah of Iran 6 years after Morse’s message. Baha’u’llah confirmed that the Badi Calendar is based on the number 19, the number of unity, and that the 19 months of 19 days each are all named after attributes of God, Light, Mercy, Beauty, Knowledge, Glory and other inspiring qualities.

The 4 or 5 days that are left are the Intercalary Days which Baha’u’llah named Ayyam-i-Ha (The Days of Happiness). These days are also called Intercalary Days. They are days of hospitality, generosity and gift-giving and preparation for the Fast, which is the last month of the Badi Calendar called “Loftiness”.

The New Year is celebrated on the 1st day of the vernal equinox and is called Naw Ruz, which is also the ancient Persian Festival of the New Year. How appropriate that the first day of spring is the first day of the New Year.

In addition, there are 9 days during the Baha’i Year of the Badi Calendar where significant Holy Days are celebrated or commemorated and on which work is suspended. These include the births and deaths of the twin Founders of the Baha’i Dispensation, The Bab and Baha’u’llah, the celebration of their Festivals associated with the Announcement of their Missions and the celebration of the New Year. In addition, there are 2 Holy Days, The Day of the Covenant and The Ascension of Abdu’l-Baha, where work is not suspended and then an additional song for the period of Ayyam-i-Ha.

The Baha’i Feasts and Holy Days Songbook represents songs for each of these 19 months and songs for each of the Holy Days throughout the year.

 

The Feasts and Holy Days Songbook

The gradual establishment of Baha’i culture has taken various forms in the beginning of a dispensation that will endure for 5000 centuries and represents the Golden Age of the human race. The primary expression of the Revelation of The Bab and Baha’u’llah so far has been in the art of architecture with the Institutions of the Faith like the Baha’i Temples in several continents and the beautiful buildings and gardens on Mount Carmel in Haifa where the Shrine of the Bab is situated and outside of Akka, Israel where Baha’u’llah’s Shrine and gardens rest. Architecture has always been the first expression of a new Revelation from God. For example, the new Baha’i Temple in Santiago, Chile is a very unique structure and was designed by a Canadian architect, Siamak Hariri.

Even though music is usually the last and most refined expression of the culture that is a fruition of a religious dispensation, i.e. the music of Bach and Beethoven and Mozart was the fruition of the Christian dispensation and appeared over 1600 years after the life of Jesus Christ, all of us involved will continue to make these feeble attempts to capture the glory of the Revelation of The Bab and Baha’u’llah through music.

It is my hope that these songs for the Feasts and Holy Days will become a way for the Baha’i Community to express their love and devotion for these noble teachings and draw them closer to the spirit and lives of The Bab and Baha’u’llah. It is also my hope that this effort will inspire other songwriters and singers to add to this repertoire so that the Baha’i Community worldwide will raise their voices in praise of these glorious ideals and celebrate the Founders of a new and united world civilization.

                             

Countermeasure

I started writing these Feasts and Holy Days songs in early 2017 with a plan to record them during the Holy Year associated with the Bicentenary of the Birth of Baha’u’llah in 1817. Providence intervened and the Hamilton Baha’i Community invited me to provide a couple of songs for their Bicentenary Celebration called, “What If?”. Clark and Mary Darling Donnelly had written a play that was to be performed for the event and had asked the Toronto acapella group called Countermeasure to perform at the event. I had previously worked with their composer/musical director and arranger, Aaron Jensen, in a group called Cadence, so it was a happy reunion and a great pleasure to work with J-M and such a musical group of talented singers. Aaron wrote beautiful arrangements of the two songs, a reggae-inspired title song called, “What If?, and one of the Feast Songs called, “The Feast of Glory”. The singers were amazing and it seemed like a great fit to work together on these recordings.

Visit Countermeasure's Site Here

We had such a great experience working together that we decided to work together to record the Feasts and Holy Days Songbook with Countermeasure for release in the Fall of 2018 during the Bicentenary of Baha’u’llah’s Birth and the Holy Year.

We’ve made a very good beginning and have recorded several of the Feasts and Holy Days songs and plan on being finished all the work by the Fall of 2018. Stay tuned, I mean really, stay tuned as the pitch and phrasing and musical excellence are a joy to hear.

We will be releasing all the songs, both as digital downloads and physical product (CDs) as well as a complete songbook of all the music and lyrics as well as choral arrangements of all the songs before the end of October/2018.

               

Parliament of the World’s Religions   

The Parliament of the World’s Religions will be celebrated in Toronto this year from November 1st to 8th and I have been asked to be the Musical Director of the Parliament. This will give me the unique opportunity to perform many of the songs from the Feasts and Holy Days Songbook and speak about the Badi Calendar at the Sacred Music Event for the attendees, which will number approximately 10,000 souls.

story:
Short Summary: Goals/Vision/Mission

Hi all, my debut U.S. tour has recently been extended into Texas and Nashville so I created this IndieGoGo crowdfunding campaign to help make up for some uncovered costs on the road. The tour is very important to me because it’s my first U.S. Tour, which is expanding my music to listeners outside of Canada and into the U.S.A.

Since a workplace injury in 2009, I have chosen to empower people through my physical struggle, and show others how important it is to never give up and always keep following your dreams!

My approach: is to help people reach their dreams by inspiring independence, ambition, hard work, hope, love, awareness, and perseverance. You CAN  & WILL live better lives. You know what you are capable of doing, now you've just got to take the steps you need in order to reach your destination! Always keep your best foot forward and never give up! Give it all that you’ve got, keep on running towards what you believe in and you can build yourself a future!! If I can dream big and completely leave behind my old life in pursuit of the new, so can you! "John Lennon died, for what he believed" You have a choice, you have a voice, and you can always live out your best life!

 

My Motto: “See more, hear more, feel more, and BE more!” - Motive Force

 

What We Need & What You Get:

First off, this tour is not completely supported by this campaign. It has taken me 18 months to save and plan this tour in California & Arizona but the extension into Texas and Nashville is a bit heavy on expenses. The $14,447 that I raise is for some costs that currently remain uncovered. ALL of the money will go directly towards the necessary services that are needed to complete this tour (Budget is posted below). I always negotiate to get the best prices and I make every dollar go as far as I possibly can. Each contribution you make directly allows me to continue to create top-notch music for you - the listeners!

HERE’S THE BUDGET: Where the money is going

Gas = $2276

Airplanes = $1012 (3 Planes)

Vehicle rental = $3212

Busses = $749

Taxies = $623

Accommodations (Hotel & Air BnB) = $5491

Marketing = $1084

TOTAL COST = $14,447

Note: I have not included my food and other necessities in this budget. All the other expenses are coming out of my own pocket.

I am a very translucent type person when it comes to honesty and communication, so the final tour budget will be posted upon completion of the tour in April.

 

THE PERKS: What you get!

- You get the assurance that you helped a reputable musician with a track record make dreams come true and that you helped others become inspired to reach goals - That alone is priceless.

- Community - You also get to belong to a growing community of like-minded inspiring people. With any contribution, you'll be able to join the Facebook group page. You'll need to enter the email address you used to make the contribution to join the group. 

- Song & Album downloads

- Presales for Music & Merch packages.

- Brand new, never heard before original music!

- Live-streamed Q & A sessions

- Live-streamed writing sessions

- Live-streamed debut song performances

- Live stream song request hour

- Exclusive content and merch

- Knowledge/Teaching/Education hour - coaching, life and music biz

- Connections (I'm decently connected in the music industry, and you can be too)

- Basic custom song: I'll write a improv song for you. ($100)

- Standard custom song: pick what you'd want the song to be about and the feel/vibe. ($250)

Advanced custom song: Get together and tell me what you want, lyrical themes, pace/tempo, and you can perform on the recording. ($500)

- Custom songs for you, your company! ($1000)

Pro Package - Co-write it with me. Brainstorm theme, lyrics ideas, and together we will write and refine until it's complete. You also get to perform on the recording ($1000+)

All funds raised will still go towards the tour costs If I don’t reach my entire goal.

 

The Impact: Why does this all matter to me and why it should matter to you?

 

I started playing at 7 and seriously pursuing music at the age of 16. Since graduating from college in 2018, I've aimed to "Live a happy, healthy life full of abundance and ability so that I can do for others what music did for me at such a young tender age of 16. I want to help others be the best people they can be. By encouraging independence, team-work and positively inspiring you to live your lives so that YOU CAN reach your goals and pursue your dreams. Together we will be able to pass this gift of life down for future generations to come"

 

Music takes time to develop nurture and authenticate - and that just what I do - If you ask anyone who knows me they would tell you that I hold my work to a very high standard and that I never sacrifice the quality of my music for a deadline or budget - I’d rather make authentic, heart-felt, original hand-crafted music and have a great song for the world to hear then a hundred average ones.

I'm glad you are starting to get it! This is what I do and this is why we're here!

 

MY TRACK RECORD: Why am I worth investing in? - Because I’ve done this before.

I'm currently building my fan base down here on tour and my Debut EP is expected to be released this year.

I've written over 200 songs and I'm getting to the point where I feel like my song-writing is strong enough to start breaking through the clutter and competing on the rock charts and I've just begun to place my music in TV & Film!

My greatest accomplishment to date has been managing an original line up of 5 musicians for 5 years. During that time I was booking myself, promoting and performing on 2 Ontario Canada tours, all while self-recording over 40 original works from 2012-2016 and producing Motive Force's '2016 live in concert video performance' which is currently posted on our YouTube channel. This was all achieved at a positive cash flow.

In 2017 I did my first cross Canada solo tour and I graduated from Nimbus College in Vancouver at the top of my class for the music business. 

I have developed my music theory and acquired education for what I couldn’t teach myself on my own. 

I’ve put in well over 10,000 hours practicing, songwriting and performing for almost a decade now and I'm well-rooted in the rock genre!

 

THANK YOU!

I am super grateful for any contributions that I receive. I make the money go a long way and every dollar directly supports my ability to continue to create top-notch music for you in the years to come.

This is my first crowdfunding campaign ever and if this goes well this could set a precedent for my career and help solidify a strong foothold for my future in music.

 

Risks & Challenges:

The tour investment is a large risk. You never know if something is going to go wrong during the tour that can require significant investment and potentially makes the tour lose money. Health risk - Risk of an accident, injury, over-exhaustion, vehicle/equipment break-downs, and climate conditions are all factors that could enter into the reality of my tour.

Since this is a SELF MANAGED tour, I will personally be carrying out ALL the tasks needed for the duration of the tour.

This includes: Performing guitar, piano & vocals live, filming, uploading & marketing all the social media content, networking - adding and developing new relationships with the new contacts I meet along the road; tour managing; financial accounting; purchasing all the gear needed; contacting the venues; scheduling shows; navigating the route and even driving.

How I will Overcome These Challenges:

My organization skills all the way down to my diet and sleep will be essential throughout this process in order to maintain the energy levels needed to complete all these tasks.

I will maintain a healthy diet and sleep/travel schedule to ensure this tour ends as a success..

Part of the reason for this tour is to meet and make connections with people who believe in me as an artist. People who share the same values and feel passionate about my belief system can see the benefit of my music to the public enough that they want to help. On the tour, I am trying to meet a manager, booking agent and producers who want to help fulfill the vision and bring this mission to completion so just by requesting my music, suggesting me or connecting me with anyone you might know is a big help

Other Ways You Can Help:

- You can also help me for free by using the IndieGoGo Share tool.

Spreading the word and sharing this campaign on social media with your friends will greatly help me make this tour a success - and it doesn't cost you a dime!

I look forward to hearing from you!

Thanks, and wish me luck!!

~ Sonic
story_txt: Short Summary: Goals/Vision/MissionHi all, my debut U.S. tour has recently been extended into Texas and Nashville so I created this IndieGoGo crowdfunding campaign to help make up for some uncovered costs on the road. The tour is very important to me because it’s my first U.S. Tour, which is expanding my music to listeners outside of Canada and into the U.S.A.Since a workplace injury in 2009, I have chosen to empower people through my physical struggle, and show others how important it is to never give up and always keep following your dreams!My approach: is to help people reach their dreams by inspiring independence, ambition, hard work, hope, love, awareness, and perseverance. You CAN  & WILL live better lives. You know what you are capable of doing, now you've just got to take the steps you need in order to reach your destination! Always keep your best foot forward and never give up! Give it all that you’ve got, keep on running towards what you believe in and you can build yourself a future!! If I can dream big and completely leave behind my old life in pursuit of the new, so can you! "John Lennon died, for what he believed" You have a choice, you have a voice, and you can always live out your best life! My Motto: “See more, hear more, feel more, and BE more!” - Motive Force What We Need & What You Get:First off, this tour is not completely supported by this campaign. It has taken me 18 months to save and plan this tour in California & Arizona but the extension into Texas and Nashville is a bit heavy on expenses. The $14,447 that I raise is for some costs that currently remain uncovered. ALL of the money will go directly towards the necessary services that are needed to complete this tour (Budget is posted below). I always negotiate to get the best prices and I make every dollar go as far as I possibly can. Each contribution you make directly allows me to continue to create top-notch music for you - the listeners!HERE’S THE BUDGET: Where the money is goingGas = $2276Airplanes = $1012 (3 Planes)Vehicle rental = $3212Busses = $749Taxies = $623Accommodations (Hotel & Air BnB) = $5491Marketing = $1084TOTAL COST = $14,447Note: I have not included my food and other necessities in this budget. All the other expenses are coming out of my own pocket.I am a very translucent type person when it comes to honesty and communication, so the final tour budget will be posted upon completion of the tour in April. THE PERKS: What you get!- You get the assurance that you helped a reputable musician with a track record make dreams come true and that you helped others become inspired to reach goals - That alone is priceless.- Community - You also get to belong to a growing community of like-minded inspiring people. With any contribution, you'll be able to join the Facebook group page. You'll need to enter the email address you used to make the contribution to join the group. - Song & Album downloads- Presales for Music & Merch packages.- Brand new, never heard before original music!- Live-streamed Q & A sessions- Live-streamed writing sessions- Live-streamed debut song performances- Live stream song request hour- Exclusive content and merch- Knowledge/Teaching/Education hour - coaching, life and music biz- Connections (I'm decently connected in the music industry, and you can be too)- Basic custom song: I'll write a improv song for you. ($100)- Standard custom song: pick what you'd want the song to be about and the feel/vibe. ($250)Advanced custom song: Get together and tell me what you want, lyrical themes, pace/tempo, and you can perform on the recording. ($500)- Custom songs for you, your company! ($1000)Pro Package - Co-write it with me. Brainstorm theme, lyrics ideas, and together we will write and refine until it's complete. You also get to perform on the recording ($1000+)All funds raised will still go towards the tour costs If I don’t reach my entire goal. The Impact: Why does this all matter to me and why it should matter to you? I started playing at 7 and seriously pursuing music at the age of 16. Since graduating from college in 2018, I've aimed to "Live a happy, healthy life full of abundance and ability so that I can do for others what music did for me at such a young tender age of 16. I want to help others be the best people they can be. By encouraging independence, team-work and positively inspiring you to live your lives so that YOU CAN reach your goals and pursue your dreams. Together we will be able to pass this gift of life down for future generations to come" Music takes time to develop nurture and authenticate - and that just what I do - If you ask anyone who knows me they would tell you that I hold my work to a very high standard and that I never sacrifice the quality of my music for a deadline or budget - I’d rather make authentic, heart-felt, original hand-crafted music and have a great song for the world to hear then a hundred average ones.I'm glad you are starting to get it! This is what I do and this is why we're here! MY TRACK RECORD: Why am I worth investing in? - Because I’ve done this before.I'm currently building my fan base down here on tour and my Debut EP is expected to be released this year.I've written over 200 songs and I'm getting to the point where I feel like my song-writing is strong enough to start breaking through the clutter and competing on the rock charts and I've just begun to place my music in TV & Film!My greatest accomplishment to date has been managing an original line up of 5 musicians for 5 years. During that time I was booking myself, promoting and performing on 2 Ontario Canada tours, all while self-recording over 40 original works from 2012-2016 and producing Motive Force's '2016 live in concert video performance' which is currently posted on our YouTube channel. This was all achieved at a positive cash flow.In 2017 I did my first cross Canada solo tour and I graduated from Nimbus College in Vancouver at the top of my class for the music business. I have developed my music theory and acquired education for what I couldn’t teach myself on my own. I’ve put in well over 10,000 hours practicing, songwriting and performing for almost a decade now and I'm well-rooted in the rock genre! THANK YOU!I am super grateful for any contributions that I receive. I make the money go a long way and every dollar directly supports my ability to continue to create top-notch music for you in the years to come.This is my first crowdfunding campaign ever and if this goes well this could set a precedent for my career and help solidify a strong foothold for my future in music. Risks & Challenges:The tour investment is a large risk. You never know if something is going to go wrong during the tour that can require significant investment and potentially makes the tour lose money. Health risk - Risk of an accident, injury, over-exhaustion, vehicle/equipment break-downs, and climate conditions are all factors that could enter into the reality of my tour.Since this is a SELF MANAGED tour, I will personally be carrying out ALL the tasks needed for the duration of the tour.This includes: Performing guitar, piano & vocals live, filming, uploading & marketing all the social media content, networking - adding and developing new relationships with the new contacts I meet along the road; tour managing; financial accounting; purchasing all the gear needed; contacting the venues; scheduling shows; navigating the route and even driving.How I will Overcome These Challenges:My organization skills all the way down to my diet and sleep will be essential throughout this process in order to maintain the energy levels needed to complete all these tasks.I will maintain a healthy diet and sleep/travel schedule to ensure this tour ends as a success..Part of the reason for this tour is to meet and make connections with people who believe in me as an artist. People who share the same values and feel passionate about my belief system can see the benefit of my music to the public enough that they want to help. On the tour, I am trying to meet a manager, booking agent and producers who want to help fulfill the vision and bring this mission to completion so just by requesting my music, suggesting me or connecting me with anyone you might know is a big helpOther Ways You Can Help:- You can also help me for free by using the IndieGoGo Share tool.Spreading the word and sharing this campaign on social media with your friends will greatly help me make this tour a success - and it doesn't cost you a dime!I look forward to hearing from you!Thanks, and wish me luck!!~ Sonic

story:
Short Summary

Hey there! I'm Mercury Slim, Indie singer-songwriter and recording artist from Santa Fe, NM. It was just over three years ago that I packed up everything I could fit in my car and drove out West to Los Angeles. Now, after living a little, I have songs and stories to share. 

My team and I are doing something we've never seen or heard of before, recording and releasing the first two singles, and inviting YOU to become part of the rest of the album's story and journey. With your contribution to this campaign, you get to be an integral part of bringing this music to life!

 

Album Cost Breakdown

Recording The Album- 10,000       -- This Is Where I Need Your Help--

​I'll be recording the album with the Producer/Engineer/Mixer and Audio Wizard himself, Mr. Jon Gilbert (Mt.Joy, The Kills, Pete Bjorn, Adam Melchore), at his studio in Pasadena, CA.

The 10,000 will go towards: studio time, session musicians, mixing and editing.

     Mastering The Album for Digital and Vinyl- 3000   -- This Is What Im Covering --

I'll be covering this cost. Ill continue working as much as possible as i have been this whole time and pouring my hard earned money into the project.

    Music Videos- 3000                   -- This Is What Im Covering --

 This includes: hiring a director + actors, cinematography, animation, and post-production.

I'll be covering this cost. Ill continue working as much as possible as i have been this whole time and pouring my hard earned money into the project.

   Marketing/Promotion- 4000          -- This Is What Im Covering --

   This includes: album promo (social media, magazines, blogs, radio play), and PR company.

I'll be covering this cost. I'll continue working as much as possible as i have been this whole time and pouring my hard earned money into the project.

 

Perks 

Check out the amazing list of perks you can receive by donating! Some of which include:

*A deluxe digital version of the album not released anywhere else

*Tea with Slim

*A Mercury Slim signed guitar

*A personalized poem, and a comparison of you to a work of art and why

*Your choice of a CD, a pink cassette, and a one of a kind 45''

*A private house concert

*Combos & Packages

**** To contribute without any Perks just click the "Back It" button at the top of the page****

 

 The Journey & The Impact

I appreciate everyone who's has been a part of this journey and those of you who are just joining now! The reception of Polka Dot Shoes and Fade To Blue has been overwhelmingly positive and both are gaining some good momentum. For those of you who don't know, they are the two singles we have recorded for the album so far.

You can listen here:

 https://songwhip.com/album/mercury-slim/polka-d...

When we began recording the songs last year, It was a mixture of me working as much as possible to pull together the money to record, and then getting into the studio whenever Jon was free. At the rate we're going now, it would take two more years for us to finish this album. So we've decided to let the people choose whether it gets here in over a 2 years time or whether it can be here as early as this summer!

The songs for this album have been written over the past couple of years, and are based on my experiences here in LA of love, loss, economic hardship, disdain for the current political climate and culture. Putting your self in someone else's shoes. About embracing my inner masculinity and femininity. It's about trying to navigate the world within and also letting your inner voice out. Ultimately, it's about how no matter what we're going through, we can always rise above.

​The songs are complete and ready to record, but one thing I've learned here in the City of Angels, is that I can't go it alone. Jon and I are prepared to knock the album out as early as this summer. This is where I need your help! By contributing to the campaign and joining our team, I know that  all together, we can lift this project up. All together we can get these Mercury Slim songs out to the world.

 

Risks & Challenges

If for any reason we don't reach our $10,000 goal the album will have to be smaller than planned 10-12 , or it will be an EP but it will ALL go to getting the music to the people!

Through this journey I've learned that no matter what happens, we can rise above. And no matter what happens, I will see to it that this music will get to the people.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just don't have the means to contribute, you can still join the journey by sharing the campaign on social media you have and getting the word out.

  • Keep up with the campaign and the progress of the album by following me on Instagram @mercuryslim_

  • You can share the campaign on social media and email by using the share tools provided by Indiegogo to the right of the campaign video at the top of the page.

Through this journey I've learned that no matter what happens, we can rise above. And no matter what happens, I will see to it that this music will get to the people.

 
Other Ways You Can Help
If you just don't have the means to contribute, you can still join the journey by sharing the campaign on social media you have and getting the word out.

Keep up with the campaign and the progress of the album by following me on Instagram @mercuryslim_

You can share the campaign on social media and email by using the share tools provided by Indiegogo to the right of the campaign video at the top of the page.

story:
IMAGINE.. A revival sweeping the country, radically impacting drug addicts and bringing the hope of Jesus to the hurting and struggling.
 

Hi! My name is Allan. 18 years ago I was an incarcerated drug addict. It was then that God set me free and gave me hope and a future. Today, Allan Scott Band shares the love of Jesus with many who are struggling and addicted in drug rehabs, prisons & churches across the country. Two years ago, 225 of you helped us record an album of songs. Over the past few years, those songs have been used at  270 events (including 28 state penitentiaries) to share Jesus with thousands of hurting people. And this year, in the midst of all the uncertainty and chaos sweeping the nation, God has given us the desire to create a national tour specifically for the addicted, hurting and struggling. This will undoubtedly be the biggest undertaking that we have ever attempted. But we believe that now more than ever, people need to experience the hope that Jesus gives. 

With that in mind, starting in the Spring of 2021 and continuing for as many years as God allows, ‘The Story Tour’ will be held in churches, community centers, prisons, and rehabs across the country. Each event will be a one-night musical journey featuring the hopeful original music of ASB, live speakers, powerful testimonies & teaching, times of ministry and God stories from across the USA. Stories of freedom from addiction, depression and eating disorders. Stories of amazing healings and restored marriages. All designed to communicate one idea: with Jesus, your story isn’t over!  We believe this will be a powerful and unique experience for those who are hurting and addicted.  It is our goal that this event will be able to tour for years into the future, as long as there is a need.

 

And we can’t do it without you! This will be a ticketed event with ticket prices kept intentionally low. Large groups of tickets will be given away to those in drug rehabs and to those who can’t afford them but want to come. We will also bring the event free of charge to Penitentiaries. We estimate the cost to develop and launch the tour will be around $80,000, half of which we hope to raise through this campaign. Would you please consider supporting this project? When you do, you will be the hands and feet of Jesus in the lives of those who may be addicted, hurting or incarcerated. Thank you!


Below: Hear how Brenna was impacted at one of our penitentiary events:


Below: Allan Scott Band ministers to inmates in Culpeper County, VA


Goal

It is our goal to raise $40,000 though this campaign which will help cover the costs of:
 

Penitentiary Events

Free Tickets To Those In Need

Keeping Ticket Prices Low

Promotions

Travel Expenses

Video Work

Lighting 

Perks/Incentives 

Indiegogo Fees


Will COVID Prevent Spring Events?

We currently have an estimated 17 events scheduled for the spring. In addition, we will be booking 10 events in penitentiaries. If COVID prevents these spring events, they will be moved to the Fall of 2021. We believe that ‘The Story Tour’ is something that God has called us to do. We are 100% committed to this tour one way or the other.

 

What happens if the project is not fully funded?

We are committed to creating this tour either way! We have been working on this project for most of 2020.  If we don't reach our goal, we will reassess what needs to be done to fit into the financial constraints and also figure out how to raise funding additional ways. 

We have actually already begun creating, designing, and booking "The Story Tour". Here is a list of current tentative tour stops:

Wilkes Barre, PA
Bechtelsvile, PA
Horseheads, NY
Lima, OH
Toledo, OH
Cadillac, MI
Lansing, MI
Clarkston, MI
Woodhaven, MI
Jamestown, NY
Lancaster, PA
Philadelphia, PA
Burnham, PA
Caribou, ME


Incentives

We have crafted 9 ways to say THANK YOU :-) Including unreleased acoustic versions of songs, Tour Tickets, Lifetime passes to The Story Tour, Tour T-shirts (below) and amazing one of a kind Tour Experiences! Take a look over there >>>>>>>  to find out more!   

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you can't back this project financially....but you can still help! Would you be willing to spread the word about the campaign? We would be so grateful :-) Sharing our campaign (using the Indiegogo social media sharing tools) makes a huge difference in bringing this project to life. Thank you!

Thank you for making a difference with us!

story:
ASSIST IN THE DEVELOPMENT

The app is going to be a free-to-play, colorful music training game. The goal is to tap the correct notes displayed on your screen while the in-game character is dodging obstacles and advancing higher to each stage! There will be items, different character selections, upgrades and fun boss battles included as well. Player scores will be on display on the in-app leaderboard and the highest scoring players will get tons of rewards and merch in and outside of the game! In order to create the highest quality product (along with the app development) I've invested a lot of time and attention to detail into making sure every level of the music course was very well thought-out and presented in the clearest way possible. In order to run the website and develop the app, this has taken a good amount of funding and requires a team of professionals to fully bring this idea to life! Because of this, I've started a campaign that would go 100% into the development of these products and into building the best possible team to make it happen! Thank you for being on this journey with me!

 

WHAT IS MUTTYTONES?

Muttytones is an interactive and highly detailed music course, specifically designed for musicians of any skill level to truly break barriers and progress at the fastest possible rate. Within this course, I've combined my own homemade methods and personal experiences on how I learned (playing for 6 years total) and grew consistently. 

My name is Jahari Stampley. I am a Chicago-born pianist began playing the piano at the age of 14. At the age of 18 years old, I was recognized and followed by many world renowned musicians including Jill Scott, Yebba Smith, Robert Glasper, Cory Henry, Jacob Collier, Derrick Hodge, Travis Sayles, Mike Mitchell, Isaiah Sharkey, among others. I have had the honor to play on Derrick Hodge’s recent album. I am the winner of the $6000 Bösendorfer prize for the international 2019 American Jazz Pianists Association Competition (for ages 18-25).

Your support means the world! I am thrilled to share this with you all!

 

THE IMPACT

Your contribution would help me complete this project geared towards helping the development of the website and the app that would be used to assist the course! I'd be able to help share my methods to the world in the clearest way possible and hopefully help people (who have been struggling musically) reach a higher level in their playing!

There will be items, different character selections, upgrades and fun boss battles included as well. Player scores will be on display on the in-app leaderboard and the highest scoring players will get tons of rewards and merch in and outside of the game! In order to create the highest quality product (along with the app development) I've invested a lot of time and attention to detail into making sure every level of the music course was very well thought-out and presented in the clearest way possible. In order to run the website and develop the app, this has taken a good amount of funding and requires a team of professionals to fully bring this idea to life! Because of this, I've started a campaign that would go 100% into the development of these products and into building the best possible team to make it happen! Thank you for being on this journey with me!
 
WHAT IS MUTTYTONES?
Muttytones is an interactive and highly detailed music course, specifically designed for musicians of any skill level to truly break barriers and progress at the fastest possible rate. Within this course, I've combined my own homemade methods and personal experiences on how I learned (playing for 6 years total) and grew consistently. 
My name is Jahari Stampley. I am a Chicago-born pianist began playing the piano at the age of 14. At the age of 18 years old, I was recognized and followed by many world renowned musicians including Jill Scott, Yebba Smith, Robert Glasper, Cory Henry, Jacob Collier, Derrick Hodge, Travis Sayles, Mike Mitchell, Isaiah Sharkey, among others. I have had the honor to play on Derrick Hodge’s recent album. I am the winner of the $6000 Bösendorfer prize for the international 2019 American Jazz Pianists Association Competition (for ages 18-25).
Your support means the world! I am thrilled to share this with you all!
 

THE IMPACT
Your contribution would help me complete this project geared towards helping the development of the website and the app that would be used to assist the course! I'd be able to help share my methods to the world in the clearest way possible and hopefully help people (who have been struggling musically) reach a higher level in their playing!

story:
Short Summary

   Hey everyone! My name is Lawrence Pennington. You probably know me by my artist name, Bear Witness. I'm launching this campaign to help fund my dream of creating a conscious movement via dope music and lyrical content.

   For those of you who don't know who I am, you can find my music on all of your favorite streaming platforms by searching "Bear Witness".

   Ever since I was a kid, I've always wanted to be a musician. Not only to tell my story but to make an impact on the world. It wasn't until about 6 years ago that I decided to really pursue music. I hopped into the studio in 2014 and released my first singles, "The World is a Playground" and "Permeate the Air". Music videos for those singles shortly followed, and I gained a following almost overnight. It's been quite a journey so far, and I'm so grateful for all of the love and support I get from all of my wonderful fans out there.

   After years of getting the runaround from different labels and investors and shelling out massive amounts of money for studio time, I decided I was going to go fully independent. Build my own recording studio and start my own record label. And so, Permeate Records was born.

   As the founder and very first artist under Permeate Records, my goal is to take it all the way to the top in order to reach the ears of the masses. I've created this label not only for my own music but so that I can bring other conscious artists on the journey and give them the opportunity to have the platform that they deserve. 

   Recently I quit my day job and decided that I'm going to go at this full time. I've got all of the tools and skills necessary to succeed at making this dream a reality. There's just one thing I'm really lacking: Adequate funding. And that's where, hopefully, you can help.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I'm hoping to raise around $50,000 or more to really give this movement a push. We need funds for things like more equipment, touring, merchandise, music videos, marketing campaigns, playlist placing, features with big artists, etc.
  • I just want to be clear that I'm not asking for any handouts. Each donor will get perks like access to exclusive content and merchandise before it reaches the public, as well as other incentives according to donation tier. Be sure to click on the perks to check out what you get for your donation.
  • If for some reason we don't hit out goal, that's okay. With Indiegogo, we don't have to reach the goal to get the funds. Any funds raised will still help the label get where it needs to go and ease the burden of taking on this financial challenge on my own. However, I'm fairly confident that our goal will be reached. And if we surpass it, even better.

The Impact

  • I had made the realization many years ago that lyrical music, particularly hip-hop, has the biggest influence on the youth of the future generations. The kids want to do what the rappers do. Instead of glorifying things like violence, materialism, and negativity, let's give the people something that will uplift them. Expand their consciousness. Help them find happiness. Encourage them to have fun and most importantly: Be themselves.
  • A lot of you have heard my music, some of you may have not. Before donating, I encourage you to check it out and feel the vibe.  Get to know what Bear Witness is about. Throughout the years, I have grown both as a person and as an artist. I am committed to using my platform with good intentions in order to aid in spreading awareness of things like civil injustice, mental health issues and social struggles and to encourage concepts like authenticity, unconditional love and open communication.

Risks & Challenges

  • Ask any independent artist out there. Dedicating yourself to any project, especially art, comes with ups and downs and always has room for failure. However, I have full confidence that with your help as a community, Permeate can become one of the most successful record labels in history
  • Despite what challenges may get thrown our way, we will take every precaution necessary to avoid them. We will overcome all obstacles and live out the intended goal of success. Each backer will be subscribed to an email list to get updates along the way so that you can see our progress and how your donation is being spent

Other Ways You Can Help

  • I understand that times aren't the best for everyone financially. Some people are thriving while others are struggling. If you can't donate, that's completely okay. You can help by sharing this campaign and by liking and following "Permeate Records" on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/permeaterecords
  • Thank you for your time today and remember to smile because YOU are BEAUTIFUL :)

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that times aren't the best for everyone financially. Some people are thriving while others are struggling. If you can't donate, that's completely okay. You can help by sharing this campaign and by liking and following "Permeate Records" on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/permeaterecords

Thank you for your time today and remember to smile because YOU are BEAUTIFUL :)

story:
Chi Siamo? (Who we are)

IT

Siamo Davide Andrea Alfredo Simone e Armando, siamo gli Yasna e veniamo da Messina, dal profondo sud dell'Europa.

La band nasce nel 2017, da un'idea di Andrea, che si è divertito a unire prog e groove prendendo spunto dalla filosofia di Nietzsche e Shopenhauer 


La nostra musica si potrebbe definire progressive metal MA non siamo la solita band stereotipo di metallari  brutti e cattivi e anzi, per quanto il nostro sia un album VIOLENTO, puntiamo ad essere  accessibili anche a chi non ha mai ascoltato questo genere, alternando strutture ritmiche complesse a parti decisamente melodiche.

ENG

We are Davide, Andrea, Alfredo, Simone and Armando, we are Yasna, coming from Messina, from the deepest south of Europe

The band was born in 2017, when Andrea had the funny idea to mix progressive and groove metal sound with philosophical lyrics inspired by Nietzsche and Schopenhauer. 

Our music could be defined as progressive metal BUT we’re not the stereotypical band of ugly and bad metal heads, in fact, although our album might seem VIOLENT, we aim to be reachable even for those who have never heard this genre, by switching between complex patterns of rhythm and melodic parts. 

 

Qual è il nostro obbiettivo?(What's our goal?)

IT

Il nostro obbiettivo è quello di registrare le canzoni che abbiamo creato, così da dar vita al nostro primo album.

Ovviamente non abbiamo intenzione di fermarci qui: Intendiamo continuare a lavorare per dar vita a numerose altre tracce, impegnandoci a migliorare sempre più la qualità dei nostri lavori, senza dimenticare il lato della musica live. La nostra speranza è quella di riuscire a portare in giro il nostro lavoro, in modo da condividerlo con il maggior numero di persone possibile! 

Per realizzare tutto questo però  abbiamo bisogno di supporto del vostro supporto, non solo economico. Abbiamo bisogno di un feedback riguardo quello che è stato il nostro lavoro fino ad adesso.

ENG

Our goal is to record our first album, with the songs we created in these years.

Obviously not only that: We'll keep working on our songs and production to increase even more the quality of our future works. not forgetting live music, sure. We'd love to take our songs as many places as possible.

But to achieve this, we need your support. We need a feedback of what we have made until now.

 

Cosa ottieni supportandoci? (What you get by supporting us?)

IT

Supportandoci qui su Indiegogo potrete ottenere dei perk che includono sia la versione dell'album (digitale o fisica), sia numerosi altri articoli come, ad esempio, maglietta e zaino.

Ma non solo: per i più generosi sono previsti perk che includono una cena o anche un LIVE!

(Tutti gli articoli saranno spediti al termine della produzione e della stampa)

Chi volesse supportarci su indiegogo e ha la possibilità di ritirare il perk A MANO, potrà semplicemente effettuare una donazione libera dell'importo corrispondente al perk desiderato (evitando così i costi di spedizione), indicando nelle note i propri dati, contatti e il perk scelto!

Ve lo consegneremo personalmente entro la data indicata!

ENG 

By supporting us on Indiegogo you'll receive a perk including the album (Digital or CD), t-shirt, backpack or even more.

But that's not all: The most generous donors can achieve perks that include a dinner or even a LIVE!

(All perks will be shipped after the end of the production and print process)

story:
HI EVERYONE!

My name is Kileza, I'm an indie r&b singer songwriter. I've spent the last few years as a musical nomad, singing and playing across Europe. Some of the highlights of my career include singing at the Classic Open Air in Berlin, Gigging with Boney M, and singing for the German President.

 

Now, I'm making an album! Songs about my experiences in the cities I've lived in; and the love and loss that comes with that. I'll be also touching on my upbringing in South Africa and how that challenged the things I come across on this side of the world. 

 

Helping me to achieve this will send me to the moon and back! I'd be delighted to able to make the music the very best it can be. 

 

About Kileza

 

  • Featured in Google Pixel Advert (USA)
  • Songwriter at Universal Music 
  • Marcia Barrett of Boney M Tour
  • Sang for President of Germany “Bundespräsident” Joachim Gauck
  • Kileza's Live Concert on Jazz Radio Berlin - 106.8
  • Choir feature under "Donna Brown's Golden Gospel Pearls "The Voice of Germany”
  •  
 

 

What I Need & What You Get

I've finished recording the 7 Demos, and 2 songs out of 5 are fully completed, with videos. The next step is to finish the production of the remaining songs, and to mix and master them. Once that's completed I'll press some CD's and finish the graphic design for the album.

So far I've invested €6000 of my own funds into the project, and these are the remaining costs that need to be covered.

Production: €2500

Mixing & Mastering: €2000

CD - 500 Copies €1250

Graphic Design: €750

The Perks

I'm really excited about the perks; some of them are really whimsical, and through some of them you get a deeper insight to the meanings behind the songs. I look forward to connecting with you all through them.

 

The Impact

Completing this project is valuable to me because it will allow me to profit off of all I've learned by being around some of the best in my field. I've learned from my past and I look forward to gifting the world with something beautiful, soothing and unique. I feel like the world shines a little brighter when we each get to shine our own light.

I've been working with some incredible producers from Berlin, Stockholm and London, some of which I've met through songwriting at record companies, at music conferences, and others with whom I've had the pleasure of writing on songwriting camps.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If contributing financially is not an option for you, and you still want to help; spreading the word using the Indiegogo share tools would be very much appreciated.

story:
I was born and raised in Fort Lauderdale, Florida. I started out in the music industry writing and producing my own songs since the age of 7. I've always felt that it was important to know the industry before getting into the music business. 

I've fulfilled my duties with the record labels, and now I'm free to pursue a new direction. This involves raising money from new fans, and the people who have been enjoying my music for the last 6 years.  


My music is different from other artists in this industry because I say what people may think, but won't say. I also leave out the hate, and the woman bashing, because it doesn't send a good message to fans, and I'd rather not go there. 

The music I create is very relationship driven. I talk about the kind of things that might be going through people's minds. This comes from both perspective, and experience from what people may be going through on a  personal level.

Now that I have the freedom to take my music where it where I want it to go, I'm going to be delivering 3 new EP's that are more commercially appealing, without losing the Real Deal JRoe brand in the process. The beats will be better, but, it's still me. 


I'm crowdfunding the next record because it provides us with a way to raise the funds I need to create a 3 song EP. These next few songs are going to represent a pivotal change in the style of my music. It's going to be more mainstream R&B/Pop. 

The success of my next album depends on how much money I raise for this campaign. 

My team set a $1,500 goal on Indiegogo, that we have to reach the first week we launch the campaign. However, we are striving to reach a bigger goal to be able to work with bigger producers, pay for studio time, and to create an album after the EP. 

Everyone that donates will receive the 3 song EP after its done. That's what you all are getting for helping us fund this project. 

By helping fund this campaign, your taking part in changing how new music is created. 

This industry is changing, and we're finding new and improved ways to get our records made, without the record label as the middleman. 

This allows me to retain full control over how my music is written, composed, and distributed, without having to take shortcuts and making compromises. 

Help us make the best record to date, fund this campaign today.

Everything I do, I have to give it to my fans. The music I create is for them." -Real Deal JRoe

With this stretch goal I would be able to record the album with eight to ten tracks mixed and mastered professionally. We've been strategizing with some of the top amazing engineers, producers and songwriters in the music industry. 

With this stretch goal I will be able to make incredible music videos that will hopefully become timeless and work with some incredible photographers and directors.

With this stretch goal I will be able to hire a high level publicist to get me major press interviews, Events and Reward Shows.

With this stretch goal I will be able to hire a marketer to promote my music online, TV, as well as stores like best buy, f.y.e. and everywhere you hear are are able to purchase music.

 

With this stretch goal I will be able to get my first debut single played  on national to AC radio stations in the United States.

With this stretch goal I will be able to do a national tour around the US. 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP: 

If you can’t contribute to my campaign, there are a few ways you can help.

1. Share this campaign on Facebook 

2. Tweet about this campaign

After you’ve done at least 1 of these 3 things, please email us and we’ll send you 3 free tracks. It’s as simple as that. We appreciate your support! -JRoe

story:
My friends,


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vNg9-d2Qx24


The above link is a live performance of a song I wrote. Please watch and enjoy. I originally wrote this song to show my dad how much I appreciate his service to our country. Every time I play it, the response is extremely positive and incredibly humbling. I now realize that I need to share it with every veteran that I can, to let them know that there are many of us who appreciate them and the sacrifices that they make. All of the donations will be used to get me to Nashville and pay for expenses including studio time and musicians. I want to thank you all for your support and encouragement.

Even if you can't help this project financially, please continue to support and pray for our troops!

Sincerely,

Steven W. Smith


Welcome Home

Words and Music Copyright: Steven W. Smith 1/30/2012


"A young man in a uniform coming home from a foreign war

Never really knowing why or what he was fighting for

Just standing up for freedom and his country on a cold and distant shore

As he walks off of the airplane into this busy place

A pretty little hippie girl with blond hair full of grace

Comes up like she's gonna hug him, then yells "Baby Killer!!!" & spits right in his face

That's the story my Daddy tells 'bout his return from Vietnam

No ticker-tape parades no welcome home or shaking hands

Just shamed and forgotten by his country like no one gave a damn

Even as a young boy I knew that was wrong

All these unsung heroes were just trying to get along

And it's about time someone spoke up for them all and gave them all a song


Cause there are Heroes Among Us

People you may know

They heard the call of freedom and they chose to go

There are Heroes Among Us

Faces old and new

They lay down their lives for me and you

So wherever you may see them, wherever you may roam

It's about time we said "Thank you for your Service!" & "Welcome Home!"


A Father and a Mother a Husband and a Wife

Brothers, Sisters, Sons and Daughters all with Families and Lives

But they all put on that uniform and make that sacrifice

Wherever there is trouble that threatens Liberty

Whether right here in our neighborhoods or far across the sea

You can bet they're right there giving all they've got to fight to keep us free


Cause they are Heroes Among Us

People you may know

They heard the call of freedom and they chose to go

They are Heroes Among Us

Spirits tried and true

They lay down their lives for me and you

So wherever you may see them, wherever you may roam

It's about time we said "Thank you for your Service!" & "Welcome Home!"


I know that we salute them on Memorial and Veteran's Days

I've seen them when they're marching in the 4th of July Parade

But there's 362 other days in the year for our thanks to be displayed


(INSTRUMENTAL BREAK)


So if you've ever worn the uniform stand up proud and tall

We're glad that you were there when our backs were against the wall

And we want you to know that we salute you and appreciate you all


Cause you are Heroes Among Us

Now you know we know

That you heard the call of freedom and you chose to go

You are Heroes Among Us

For Red White & Blue

You lay down your lives just doing what you do

So wherever we may see you, wherever you may roam

It's about time we said "Thank you for your Service!" & "Welcome Home!"


"Welcome Home!"

We Thank God For You!

"Welcome Home!"
story_txt:
My friends, https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vNg9-d2Qx24The above link is a live performance of a song I wrote. Please watch and enjoy. I originally wrote this song to show my dad how much I appreciate his service to our country. Every time I play it, the response is extremely positive and incredibly humbling. I now realize that I need to share it with every veteran that I can, to let them know that there are many of us who appreciate them and the sacrifices that they make. All of the donations will be used to get me to Nashville and pay for expenses including studio time and musicians. I want to thank you all for your support and encouragement.Even if you can't help this project financially, please continue to support and pray for our troops!Sincerely, Steven W. SmithWelcome

story: This may be one of the cheesiest things I've ever done.  Aside from that, I have various things I'd like to see achieved with this particular Grimes Fest.  First of all I would like to pay the V's rent for the month following this event.  I would also like to possibly fly a friend or two out to do special performances.  Another thing is to buy food and beverage to feed everyone that attends.  If you donate you will get your name on a list to attend the event, advance tickets sort of without the tickets.  Also we will make sure to include many of the recordings and various oddities made by the performers and our/their friends.  Grimes Fest will take place on Saturday July 25th at the V, starts at 2pm.  We will give you directions on how to get here if you donate.

story:
"I wanna scan you like a BARCODE..."

Hi everyone! On behalf of myself, my co-writer Lori Martini, our producer Rich DeCicco, and our team, welcome to our crowdfund page to create an awesome, fun, summer sexy video for "Barcode."  Blurred Lines, Just Dance, and Party in the USA are gonna have NUTHIN on this!  Wait, you haven't heard "Barcode" yet?  Our bad! Allow us to introduce it, via this very cool feature "Elmore Magazine" did on the song and our previously produced lyric video: http://goo.gl/hL2KiQ

Want to join the team?

"...Know everything that there is to know..."

So, what exactly does BARCODE need to rock the silver, small, and mobile screen?

A team of highly trained professionals, not unlike a grocery store staff, to make sure we work together to whip you up something visually, musically delicious! Your generous contributions will help support:

THE CREW! Director, Director of Photography, Camera People, Lighting Pros, Costume, Makeup, Assistants

THE CAST! I mean, this song calls for dancers, don't you think?

COOL MOVIE MAKING MAGIC STUFF: A blank canvas studio, Cameras, lighting, costumes, makeup, props

POST PRODUCTION: Color balancing, editing, rendering so you can feast your eyes on the finished product

THE DREAM: We admit it. We really believe in this song and want to see it "go big!" Your contributions will help make that HAPPEN!

...and what will you get, you ask?

"...Yeah, I want your digits, wanna know where you been at, and what you like, so what's your price?"

You don't go into the grocery store and come out with a carload of free groceries (unless you're the most amazing coupon cutter in the world, aka my Mom), so we know you're wondering what you'll get for contributing.  How bout:

Music!   T-shirts!    Concerts!   Coffee and/or Skype dates with us!   Songwriting lessons, voice-over coaching, and more swag we'll be giving away throughout the campaign.  Plus, we know many of you have been amazingly supportive of our past creative endeavors, so, if there's a reward you wish you saw here that you don't, EMAIL US and let us know- it could be your lucky day and we might just hook it up!


SCANTASTIC!

That is what we think you are. Super scannable :-)  We know not everyone is in the position to join our creative team by contributing in exchange for rewards, but that doesn't mean you can't join us. We'd love to have you on board sharing this campaign (there are Sharing tools right here on IndieGoGo), and sharing the song itself, too!  Every single person who downloads the song, posts, tweets, emails, or talks about it to friends and colleagues- we see you! And we thank you. Music is nothing without the fans. THANK YOU for supporting this song and this project! 

Hear Barcode free on Soundcloud: https://goo.gl/xKXyBz

story:
Summary

Fans, Friends, Supporters and Family I have a chance to go back overseas for an International Tour with Nekfeu and his L'Entourage/S'Crew family. My recent trip in June 2015 of only two weeks built a buzz with the help of you all spreading my music and photos from that trip alone. With 15 stops on the tour and the potential for showcases, appearances and endorsements as well as an invite to the March/April Tour, this can be the step needed to get my career in the lights.

Coming from Pomona, Ca, skateboarding and beating a heart condition, all I have ever known was to give back and share. This won't only be a win for me but also for my peers doing music in the same areas as me. I bring light to my city and fellow musicians, help support whether its financially, physically or emotionally; I embark on this endeavor with hopes to one day be able to create a string of jobs and bring back something to my hometown and community through music.

Why $15K

France is a beautiful place but also expensive. Having spent almost $10,000.00 of my own money I saved with a majority of it being on the last minute trip to Paris last June, I work day and night to to reach endless goals such as this. With your help I will be able afford the open ticket for travel, food and living accommodations. Thanks to Nekfeu and his label I have a spot on the tour with all the stage accommodations covered while on the road for a month.
This Amount will also help me to Print and Create various items like CDs, T-Shirts/Sweaters, Stickers and other Novelty Items to be released for the tour.

In the event I do not reach the final goal to be able to get all that is needed, I will prioritize the amount received into what can be afforded. The Plane ticket is a major concern with it ranging in cost from $2,000-$4,000 depending on what is available. Next would be Living accommodations for the Month and a half that I will be gone on tour. Last but not Least, will be merchandise and novelty items needed to have a lasting effect on everyone I encounter overseas and those that will be sent to the various supporters of this cause even if it takes the entire amount that was raised. This is about us.

Risks & Challenges

Travel: only God can control nature.
People: If we believe it then we will all achieve it.
Anything else I may encounter I will take head on at the time it happens. I wish I can predict the future but no ones giving will have gone in vain.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cant give, a simple share of this campaign and my music is more than enough to help the dream work with your encouragement of others to give. Your time and effort with each post can potentially get the music exactly where it needs to be.

Feel Free to Reach Me with Any Ideas or Help along the way You can Provide that is Not Listed Here... Friends & Fans & Family Together.
