story:
The Long Story (Short Version)

In 2013, I organized the 1st edition of The Holland International Singer-Songwriter Festival (THISSFest). The four-day event quickly grew into one of the largest gathering of singer-songwriters in the world with more than 300 artists from over 30 countries participating in the 2nd, expanded 1-week edition beginning on Monday June 23rd and culminating with my own THISSFest Singer-Songwriter Stage on Sunday June 29th at the renowned Parkpop Festival in The Hague, Europe's oldest, most widely attended free outdoor pop music festival! 

Going into our third year, THISSFest will see many improvements including a transition away from the structure of the typical annual music festival to a unique, four-times-a-year live music event, once in each season of the year with winter, spring, summer and autumn editions—or THISSFest Sessions. And beginning with the Autumn 2015 Sessions, the events will be held in a single, seated venue featuring state-of-the-art sound and lighting, ideal for the perfect live music experience. The Autumn 2015 Sessions will take place on the 26th of September at the emblematic Rijswijkse Schouwburg on the outskirts of The Hague, and will feature 15 of the most relevant singer-songwriters of yesterday, today and tomorrow representing a dozen countries (see the complete lineup HERE).

Please buy your tickets now instead of later and help us put on an event to remember for 2015.

Crowd-Funding: The Story Behind the Story

As a singer-songwriter and music lover, my vision is to create an extraordinary musical event celebrating the art and craft of the singer-songwriter, and I am committed to making THISSFest one of the most noteworthy singer-songwriter festivals on the international scene. 

As an independent, not-for-profit initiative, I'm reaching out to you, my friends, family, fellow musicians and music lovers to help ensure that THISSFest remains an independent music festival, free from the demands and often rigid conditions placed upon cultural events by subsidizing agencies and corporate sponsors.

Please join me in supporting independent music by contributing to my campaign.

What I Need, Why I Need It: Here's what your generous contributions will fund:

While I am confident that THISSFest's Autumn 2015 Sessions will be well attended by up to 700 music lovers, my efforts to raise initial capital through early-bird ticket sales, special group discounts and sponsorship have been ineffective. Therefore, I am in immediate need of pre-festival funds to meet some pending financial obligations such as booking flights for international artists, meeting a few contractual obligations for artist and venue deposits and booking outdoor advertising space.

What You Get

In addition to the satisfaction of supporting this independent music initiative, I've come up with some very nice thank you gifts to express my gratitude for your contribution. Some of those perks include:

  • Official THISSFest 2015 t-shirts, polos and posters;
  • Special edition THISSFest 2015 coffee/tea mugs;
  • Ticket/Accommodation Packages;
  • Signed CDs and Merchandise by THISSFest Artists;
  • And more!

Impact

As Europe's only independent music festival (I receive no government subsidies or major corporate sponsorship), your generous contributions will help to fund a unique cultural event and keep THISSFest free from public funds and the demands and unpredictability of corporate sponsors.

If you are unable to help us out financially, please consider sharing news of our campaign through Facebook, Twitter and other social media platforms to help spread the word.

THISSFest 2015 Lineup

  • Howard Jones (England)
  • Paul Heaton & Jacqui Abbott (England, The Housemartins/Beautiful South)
  • Nick Howard (England, winner, The Voice of Germany)
  • Alex Alden (Malta)
  • Arthur Adam (Netherlands)
  • Cataleya Fay (Austria)
  • Hartog (Netherlands)
  • Jeanne Rouwandaal (Netherlands)
  • Joanna Weston (England)
  • Pili. (France)
  • Rina Mushonga (Zimbabwe/Netherlands)
  • Sofia Dragt (Dutch Singer-Songwriter of the Year 2013)
  • Stef Classens (Winner, "Best Singer-Songwriter in The Netherlands" 2014)
  • Thijs Vroegop (Netherlands, Tim Dawn)
  • Toon van Mil (Netherlands, winner THISSFest Play2Play competition)

story:
Today we want EVERYONE to feel Famous! In a day and age where hollywood glitz and glam is always on our radar, we want EVERYONE to feel just as Famous as a Hollywood Star!! TRUTH IS.. There are billions of stars in the sky, and you ARE one of them! Our goal in this campaign is to push a song that celebrates YOU. All your efforts, strengths and joys in one fun energizing song! Contributors will be supporting a project that can potentially speak to the masses.. a project that reminds the world that they are all Famous in their own unique ways! We all have a story, we ALL should be celebrated. WE believe that words are power.. and that what is said through music can build each other up, build self-esteem, encourage, relate or even sympathize during hard times. TESSA makes that kind of music! So let's support Music that counts! Music that is making Everyone Feel Famous!



 has been a songwriter for over 10 years in the music industry and has recently decided to release music of her own independently. She has worked with notable names, but decided to venture on her own to make personal music that reflects her new journey, but that means she's on her own and needs YOUR HELP! TESSA has worked with Starmaker Bert Padell and the lengendary Frank Dileo who was the 1st manager of The King Of Pop Michael Jackson. She has also written and arranged songs for Whitney Houston, The Sugarhill Gang, Ray Goodman and Brown and many other legendary greats. As one of the writers on Clive Davis's Sony Music Roster and background track singer for Whitney Houston, she was invited to record her first studio album Songs of A Songstress, but when news broke that her manager Frank Dileo passed away, she took a break from music.  A few years later, when she was ready to return to the business, Tessa was shockingly diagnosed with cancer and was thrown into the fight of her life. But today, she is CANCER FREE and back on her feet with this exciting project! 

"TESSA's goal is to make a difference in her community through her music and to help others who have faced challenges in life. Through her charities of choice and through her message of empowerment, Tessa hopes to inspire people to chase their dreams no matter the obstacles. MTV has now named her an "Artist To Watch" so keep watch of this rising star and make HISTORY by helping her voice reach the world!" 


What We Need & What You Get

"Rome wasn't built in a day" a quote we've all heard before and all know to be true, especially when building a project from the ground up.  We don't have fancy companies to bring this music to you effortlessly... truth is, we have to get it there on our own through advertising (a fancy way of saying a lot of legwork, flyers, posters, street teams, radio campaigns, a music video etc..) What this means is that your contribution will be used to pitch and pay marketing companies to get this song heard and the advertising ball rolling. Remember that music is "the peoples choice" but if they don't get to hear it, and don't know it exists.. then they lose that choice and only get to hear what the major companies promote. We aren't asking for thousands and thousands of dollars but simply asking for a jump start to help get her out there! It can be a $5.00 contribution or a $50.00 one. Whatever you feel compelled to give! 


The Impact

The Music Business is a business of emotions. It's one of the only businesses that transcends every other corporate structure because it's not only about money, it's about emotion. Its about the listener feeling good and delivering music that can evoke those feelings. Music is there for you during good times, hard times, laughter, sadness and love. It goes with you throughout all the days of your life. Have you ever asked yourself what your life would be like if music didn't exist? It would be a boring world. From the beginning of time, if musicians didn't push to get their music heard, that is what could have very well happened. We'd be living in a boring world, a soundless wasteland! So if you like this song, contribute and help bring something fresh, encouraging and exciting to the masses!! TESSA is a voice to be heard, so let's make her the PEOPLES CHOICE!!


Risks & Challenges

"She made it overnight" someone said. "Oh he was born with that voice" another mentioned. These are just some of the things we initially think about artists, and although it seems that their art may be so flawless and natural, it truly is an acquired skill that may have taken years to develop with many times no reward. Music is one of the most difficult skills to place in the job market, but why is that when it's one of the most enjoyed commodities? We're not going to sugar coat this and say that this song will reach the ends of the earth magically, because we know all too well that thousands of talents artists and songs go unheard everyday because of lack of funding. But we can promise you this, that we will not stop pushing this song until every stone is turned! And you will get to see every level of its growth through her social media, following the whole journey YOURSELF! You will be a direct contributor to an amazing project and will get to watch TESSA's journey unfold before your eyes from your phone, tablet, or computer... knowing that YOU are one of the hands-on sponsors! Make her dream and the dreams of so many others her music and story can touch.. COME TRUE! 


A portion of all contributions will be donated to TESSA's Charities of choice;
http://www.ovariancancer.org
http://www.cancer.org 


GET SOCIAL with TESSA

www.tessaworldwide.com 

INSTAGRAM @tessaworldwide

www.facebook.com/tessaworldwide

Tessa WILL reply back to you personally!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute today, we understand completely! But we encourage you to simply download the song on iTunes for .99 cents. By listening to the song and sharing it with family and friends, we have already achieved our main objective of spreading the word. THANK YOU!

Click here to Download FAMOUS


Much musical love,
TEAM TESSA
story_txt:
Today we want EVERYONE to feel Famous! In a day and age where hollywood glitz and glam is always on our radar, we want EVERYONE to feel just as Famous as a Hollywood Star!! TRUTH IS.. There are billions of stars in the sky, and you ARE one of them! Our goal in this campaign is to push a song that celebrates YOU. All your efforts, strengths and joys in one fun energizing song! Contributors will be supporting a project that can potentially speak to the masses.. a project that reminds the world that they are all Famous in their own unique ways! We all have a story, we ALL should be celebrated. WE believe that words are power.. and that what is said through music can build each other up, build self-esteem, encourage, relate or even sympathize during hard times. TESSA makes that kind of music! So let's support Music that counts! Music that is making Everyone Feel Famous!



 has been a songwriter for over 10 years in the music industry and has recently decided to release music of her own independently. She has worked with notable names, but decided to venture on her own to make personal music that reflects her new journey, but that means she's on her own and needs YOUR HELP! TESSA has worked with Starmaker Bert Padell and the lengendary Frank Dileo who was the 1st manager of The King Of Pop Michael Jackson. She has also written and arranged songs for Whitney Houston, The Sugarhill Gang, Ray Goodman and Brown and many other legendary greats. As one of the writers on Clive Davis's Sony Music Roster and background track singer for Whitney Houston, she was invited to record her first studio album Songs of A Songstress, but when news broke that her manager Frank Dileo passed away, she took a break from music.  A few years later, when she was ready to return to the business, Tessa was shockingly diagnosed with cancer and was thrown into the fight of her life. But today, she is CANCER FREE and back on her feet with this exciting project! 


"TESSA's goal is to make a difference in her community through her music and to help others who have faced challenges in life. Through her charities of choice and through her message of empowerment, Tessa hopes to inspire people to chase their dreams no matter the obstacles. MTV has now named her an "Artist To Watch" so keep watch of this rising star and make HISTORY by helping her voice reach the world!" 



  What We Need & What You Get
"Rome wasn't built in a day" a quote we've all heard before and all know to be true, especially when building a project from the ground up.  We don't have fancy companies to bring this music to you effortlessly... truth is, we have to get it there on our own through advertising (a fancy way of saying a lot of legwork, flyers, posters, street teams, radio campaigns, a music video etc..) What this means is that your contribution will be used to pitch and pay marketing companies to get this song heard and the advertising ball rolling. Remember that music is "the peoples choice" but if they don't get to hear it, and don't know it exists.. then they lose that choice and only get to hear what the major companies promote. We aren't asking for thousands and thousands of dollars but simply asking for a jump start to help get her out there! It can be a $5.00 contribution or a $50.00 one. Whatever you feel compelled to give! 


The Impact The Music Business is a business of emotions. It's one of the only businesses that transcends every other corporate structure because it's not only about money, it's about emotion. Its about the listener feeling good and delivering music that can evoke those feelings. Music is there for you during good times, hard times, laughter, sadness and love. It goes with you throughout all the days of your life. Have you ever asked yourself what your life would be like if music didn't exist? It would be a boring world. From the beginning of time, if musicians didn't push to get their music heard, that is what could have very well happened. We'd be living in a boring world, a soundless wasteland! So if you like this song, contribute and help bring something fresh, encouraging and exciting to the masses!! TESSA is a voice to be heard, so let's make her the PEOPLES CHOICE!!

    Risks & Challenges
"She made it overnight" someone said. "Oh he was born with that voice" another mentioned. These are just some of the things we initially think about artists, and although it seems that their art may be so flawless and natural, it truly is an acquired skill that may have taken years to develop with many times no reward. Music is one of the most difficult skills to place in the job market, but why is that when it's one of the most enjoyed commodities? We're not going to sugar coat this and say that this song will reach the ends of the earth magically, because we know all too well that thousands of talents artists and songs go unheard everyday because of lack of funding. But we can promise you this, that we will not stop pushing this song until every stone is turned! And you will get to see every level of its growth through her social media, following the whole journey YOURSELF! You will be a direct contributor to an amazing project and will get to watch TESSA's journey unfold before your eyes from your phone, tablet, or computer... knowing that YOU are one of the hands-on sponsors! Make her dream and the dreams of so many others her music and story can touch.. COME TRUE! 

A portion of all contributions will be donated to TESSA's Charities of choice;
http://www.ovariancancer.org

http://www.cancer.org 





GET SOCIAL with TESSA

www.tessaworldwide.com 
INSTAGRAM @tessaworldwide
www.facebook.com/tessaworldwide
Tessa WILL reply back to you personally!


    Other Ways You Can Help If you can't contribute today, we understand completely! But we encourage you to simply download the song on iTunes for .99 cents. By listening to the song and sharing it with family and friends, we have already achieved our main objective of spreading the word. THANK YOU!
Click here to Download FAMOUS
Much musical love,TEAM TESSA

story:
KinkyYukkyYuppy est un groupe de rock alternatif originaire d'Évreux. Malgré une apparente tranquillité au niveau des mélodies, celles-ci se construisent autour d'un mur de son énorme et d'une batterie puissante.

KinkyYukkyYuppy est ce genre de groupe qui nous transporte, qui nous touche et nous plonge dans nos propres émotions. « Si on tournait un film sur nos vies, notre musique en serait la parfaite B.O » expliquent les Kinky.

Le groupe cite lui-même des influences telles que : Biffy Clyro, A Perfect Circle, Rage against the machine, Foo Fighters, ...

Après plusieurs EP bien accueillis, les Kinky sortent leur premier album "ESCAPE" en octobre 2010.

Aujourd'hui ils reviennent avec leur deuxième album "Until the sun goes down" dont la sortie est prévue pour Mars 2016 sur le label SEND THE WOOD MUSIC.


▶ Financement du 2ème album du groupe.

▶ Financement de la communication et des goodies (T-shirts, badges, affiches, ...).
▶ Organisation d'une tournée pour la sortie de l'Album.


▶ Enregistrement, mixage, mastering : 2000 €

▶ Artwork, pressage, sdrm : 1500 €

▶ Réalisation de clips : 2000 €

▶ T-shirts, affiches, flyers : 1500 €

TOTAL 7000 €

Financé a 50% par les KinkyYukkyYuppy et le label SEND THE WOOD MUSIC

LA JAUGE INDIEGOGO  : 3500 €


01. You're wrong

02. Lonely
03. Move On
04. Until the sun goes down
05. Fighter
06. It's alright
07. Somebody else
08. Scalding tears
09. Powerless
10. Murky weather
-
BONUS TRACKS
-
11. Move On (RADIO EDIT)
12. You're wrong (RADIO EDIT)

story:
We started a new campain! You can check it out HERE.


Short Summary

Hello all! My name is Elizabeth and I'd like to share my story with you. In April of 2015, and then again in August, I visited a small elementary and middle school in Poland, in the town of Nowa Wieś. As soon as I walked in through the doors, I could feel how much heart, creativity, and perseverance these students had. The hallways pulsed with activity, and every classroom was full of attentive kids. 

As part of my trip I also had the opportunity to meet the principal, Grzegorz Żak. After taking us on the tour of the school's music room, Mr. Żak explained to us that they were trying to raise money for their music room and school band. I decided to take the initiative to help this school with their music program, and School Supporters was born. 

I invite you to get to know this school better, and to meet a few of the students you will be helping - their profiles are available at www.schoolsupporters.org. 

What We Need & What You Get

This year we want to start small. With a goal of six thousand dollars, which  converts to twenty two thousand zloty in Polish currency, we aim to supply a small school in Nowa Wieś with instruments for their music groups and music room. 

A band setup for a school this size costs approximately $10,000 dollars. School Supporters is aiming to supply the school with 50% of the funds, and the Parent Teacher Association at the school will raise the other 50%. 

WHO ARE WE HELPING?


A small public school in Nowa Wieś, Poland and the music program that they wish to expand. This school has roughly 330 students in all. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We are accepting useable instruments in good condition. We are also accepting sellable items that we will display on our website. All profits collected from the items sold will go to funding this school's music program.

For more information about this alternative way to help, please check out our website at www.schoolsupporters.org

story:
What is KUUV-LP 95.5 FM Beaumont?

For the first time in 20 years, the FCC opened a tiny window of opportunity for non-profits to apply for a radio station license.  WE GOT ONE!  Help us build a station for the progressive voices of Southeast Texas.

Our mission is to give voice to progressive people, cultures and concerns in Southeast Texas; to liberate independent, non-commercial broadcast space for creative expression and community enrichment; to promote positive change as individuals and collectives; and to increase awareness and understanding of the sacred interconnected web of life, our inherent dignity, and the value and rights of every human being.

As a low power FM (LPFM) station, we will:

  • broadcast on your radio dial at 95.5 FM,
  • reach listeners in Beaumont, TX with our broadcast signal and connect to a broader community online,
  • feature local artists, musicians and,events,
  • address local concerns, 
  • connect you to national and international interests with carefully curated content. 

Why do we need your help?

We need you to help to bring Community Radio to Beaumont. Founding a radio station is expensive! This is our kickoff fundraising campaign to help us achieve our goal.  

First and foremost, we need studio and broadcasting equipment.  

The $18,400  raised during this campaign will purchase the following equipment:

  • Studio Console $2,000
  • Microphones $700
  • Ear Headphones $300
  • Turntable $300
  • On-air Radio Automation Software $1,500
  • Encoders (transmission and streaming) $7,600
  • Antennae $1,800
  • Connecting Cables $500
  • Processors $3,300
  • Freight costs: $400

  Total: $18,400

If we do not reach our $18,400 goal, all funds raised here will still go toward the above-listed equipment. Should we surpass our goal (We believe in you, Beaumont!), excess funds will be devoted to the cost of tower lease space, additional equipment needs, and program/content licensing. 

Join our team and help create commercial-free broadcast space for progressive people in SETX!


Is this a tax deductible donation?

Yes! Yes! Yes!

We are a proud project of Spindletop Unitarian Church, a  non-profit entity. All proceeds from this campaign will go directly to KUUV. Give us your mailing or electronic address, and we will send you a receipt.

We will thank you in many ways.

We will be so grateful for your support. You can give just to give or choose one of our many thank you gifts. Have a special request? Send an email, and we'll consider it.

Would like to hear your voice on the radio? Hang out at our cool station?Check out these and other perks in the donation section.

What might go wrong?

Becoming an LPFM is a once in a lifetime opportunity. If we don’t succeed now, Beaumont will NEVER have community radio.

Can you help in other ways? Yes!

YES! We need money, but we also need your time. Volunteers, fundraisers, content developers, and studio volunteers will all be crucial to the success of this project. 

Share this link with EVERYONE!

Visit our website and like us on Facebook. 

   https://www.facebook.com/KUUVBMT

   http://www.kuuv.org/  

Let us know what you want to hear by taking our listener survey.

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/18f7E3WTSWP9RTRbfEL576hOEx-Mjm1vpxusgfLyvoOw/viewform

Program 95.5 FM to your favorites and be ready to tune in to THE Progressive Voice of Southeast Texas!

story:
Click Here for English!

BONJOUR À TOUS!
Je me nomme Justin St-Pierre et je suis un guitariste acoustique contemporain québecois, adepte du "fingerstyle". En plus des deux albums que j'ai à mon actif - Rafiot (2008); La Faille (2011) - j'ai remporté plusieurs concours de musique, dont la compétition internationale du Canadian Guitar Festival en 2013. 


Je lance ici ma première campagne Indiegogo, ceci dans le but de produire mon troisième opus: L'insulaire. 

Cet album sera principalement inspiré des bruits ambiants de l'île de Montréal, du "ôm" de la cité, de la rumeur des passants. Ce sera la ville dans toute son enivrance et sa solitude, interprétée à travers un univers acoustique envoûtant.



Bien que j'ai toujours financé moi-même mes albums par le passé, cette fois je sollicite votre appui afin de produire cet ouvrage qui représente quatre années de composition. En participant à cette campagne, vous contribuerez à la continuité de ma carrière... mais vous m'aiderez aussi à la porter à l'autre bout du monde!


Ce nouvel album sera en effet suivi d'une tournée de l'hémisphère austral qui débutera en Nouvelle-Calédonie, une petite île française nichée entre l'Australie et la Nouvelle-Zélande que j'ai découverte cette année grâce à mon frère Marc, qui travaillait là-bas. C'est là que j'ai achevé de composer les pièces de L'insulaire. 

L'insulaire... Curieux que j'ai choisi ce titre pour désigner une île, celle de Montréal, alors que c'est une île située aux antipodes qui en deviendrait l'ultime inspiration.

Cette lointaine partie du monde s'est ouverte à moi, m'a ouvert les yeux et le coeur comme seule mon Abitibi natale avait su le faire jusque là. Elle m'a redonné goût à la vie à un moment où j'avais envie de baisser les bras. Porté par cette vague, j'entends poursuivre mon aventure artistique en partageant avec vous mes récits et ma vision musicale. 

Encore une fois pour cet album, j'ai su m'entourer d'une merveilleuse équipe : 

Aux commandes de l'enregistrement, mon collègue guitariste JJ Coolidge, réalisateur du très admiré Forward, le troisième album d'Erik Mongrain. 

Ma chère amie, l'artiste graphiste de talent Geneviève Baril, créera la pochette de L'insulaire.

Léa Deborde, ma complice avec qui je prépare en ce moment la tournée du Pacifique, mais qui est aussi ma photographe ainsi que la conceptrice du site Internet ( www.justinst-pierre.com ) 

Oui, la vie est remplie de surprises. Et souvent elle sait placer les bonnes personnes sur notre route.

Vous avez envie de m'aider à concrétiser ce projet? Merci, et bienvenue dans cette belle aventure!

Voici un extrait réalisé en préproduction de Promontoire, qui sera selon moi une des pièces maîtresses de l'album :
https://soundcloud.com/justinstpierre/promontoire-excerpt


Les fonds amassés lors de cette campagne serviront à défrayer les coûts d'enregistrement, de mastering, de graphisme et de duplication de l'album. Ils serviront aussi à réaliser des vidéos promotionelles et à financer mon départ pour le Pacifique Sud!



Si cette campagne dépasse l'objectif fixé (ce qui me ferait carrément halluciner!!), j'utiliserai les fonds supplémentaires pour enregistrer un album de reprises. Les fans qui m'ont vu en spectacle et qui suivent ma carrière depuis des années m'ont souvent dit qu'ils aimeraient entendre ma voix sur disque. Quel plaisir ce serait pour moi d'exaucer ce voeu en leur offrant un album de chansons!


L'insulaire sera produit au cours de l'été 2015. Le départ pour le "Pacific Tour" est prévu pour octobre 2015, les destinations visées étant l'Australie, la Nouvelle-Zélande, la Thaïlande et le Japon. Et après? Qui sait? Tout est possible!

Toutes les personnes qui contribueront à cette campagne seront tenues informées du déroulement de l'enregistrement, et elles auront aussi accès à des extraits vidéo de mes nouvelles compositions. 

L'âme de cet album sera sans contredit ma nouvelle guitare, ''The Arrow'', un instrument exceptionnel fabriqué par un des plus grands luthiers de notre époque, Sheldon Schwartz. Cette guitare fera résonner ma musique comme jamais. 


N'hésitez pas à partager ce projet sur Facebook, Twitter et sur les autres réseaux sociaux. 

Et parlez-en à vos amis, parce que le bouche à oreille, ça fonctionne!


Merci de votre attention, de vos encouragements et de votre désir d'embarquer dans cette aventure qui représente la continuité de ma carrière. 

Je vous en serai à jamais reconnaissant.


-English-

Hi there,

My name is Justin St-Pierre, I am a Quebec fingerstyle guitarist and composer who has two albums to his credit: Rafiot (2008), and La Faille (2011). In addition to touring regularly, I’ve won several music competitions, including the prestigious international competition of the Canadian Guitar Festival in 2013.

I am now ready to record my third album, L’insulaire, a French word which means “the islander”, and so I am seeking your support in this, my very first Indiegogo campaign.

The pieces on this album were inspired by the urban soundscapes of the island of Montreal, the rumblings of the city, the boisterous buzz of its inhabitants. It expresses the elation, the joy, but also the solitude I felt, all filtered through the prism of a rapturous six-string mantra.

While my previous albums were self-financed, this time I feel compelled to let you in on the production of this collection of works which span four years of composition. Your contribution will push my career forward, and help me take it to the ends of the earth! Let me explain.

Once the recording of L’insulaire is completed, I will embark on a tour of the Southern Hemisphere that will kick off in New Caledonia, a country that I had the pleasure of discovering this year thanks to my brother Marc, who was working there. It is on this small French island of the South Pacific, nestled between Australia and New Zealand, that I put the finishing touches to the acoustic guitar pieces you will find on this album.

L’insulaire, The Islander... This title now seems strangely appropriate considering the project’s first notes resonated on one island, that of Montreal, but found their ultimate inspiration straight across the world on another.

This remote part of the world opened up to me, opened my eyes and my heart like no place before it, safe from my native Abitibi. It put colour back into my life at a time when all had gone grey, lifted me and gave new breath to my musical vision. I am now ready to share this wonderful adventure with you.

Again this time, I have an incredible team to help me out:

L’insulaire will be engineered and produced by JJ Coolidge, who also did production duties on Erik Mongrain’s third album, Forward.

The sleeve and artwork of the album will be created by my dear friend, the graphic artist Geneviève Baril.

My cherished accomplice, Léa Deborde, is taking care of the logistics for the Pacific Tour. She is also my official photographer, as well as the designer of the website ( www.justinst-pierre.com ) 

No doubt, life is full of surprises. And it has a way of putting the right people across our path.

Feel like helping me see this project to fruition? Thank you. Hope you enjoy the ride!

Here’s a sample of a piece called Promontoire (Promontory), recorded by JJ in preproduction. It’s shaping up to be one of the album’s high points:

https://soundcloud.com/justinstpierre/promontoire-excerpt

The funds collected on this campaign will finance recording, mastering, graphic design, and CD duplication. They will also enable me to produce promo videos, as well as help me reach the South Pacific!

If this campaign exceeds its target goal (which, frankly, would totally blow me away!!), I’ll use the additional funds to record a collection of cover songs. The fans who have followed my career and seen me live have often told me how they would love to hear me sing on an album. What a thrill it would be for me to grant them this wish!

L’insulaire will be recorded this summer. The Pacific Tour is set to start in October, with projected dates in Australia, New Zealand, Thailand, and Japan. After that, who knows? We’ll see where the wind takes us!

As a Justin St-Pierre contributor, you will get regular updates during the recording. I definitely want you to know how things are going! You will also have exclusive access to videos of me playing excerpts of my new compositions.

My new guitar, “The Arrow”, will undoubtedly be the heart and soul of L’insulaire. Built by one of the greatest luthiers of our time, Sheldon Schwartz, this exceptional instrument will make my music soar like never before.

Don’t hesitate to share this project on Facebook, Twitter, and on other social media.

And tell your friends! Word-of-mouth is still the best form of communication.

Thank you for your time, for your support, and for helping me take my career and my artistic vision to a higher plane.

For this, I will be forever grateful.


 

Justin St-Pierre
story_txt:
Click Here for English!BONJOUR À TOUS!


Je me nomme Justin St-Pierre et je suis un guitariste acoustique contemporain québecois, adepte du "fingerstyle". En plus des deux albums que j'ai à mon actif - Rafiot (2008); La Faille (2011) - j'ai remporté plusieurs concours de musique, dont la compétition internationale du Canadian Guitar Festival en 2013. 



Je lance ici ma première campagne Indiegogo, ceci dans le but de produire mon troisième opus: L'insulaire. 
Cet album sera principalement inspiré des bruits ambiants de l'île de Montréal, du "ôm" de la cité, de la rumeur des passants. Ce sera la ville dans toute son enivrance et sa solitude, interprétée à travers un univers acoustique envoûtant.









Bien que j'ai toujours financé moi-même mes albums par le passé, cette fois je sollicite votre appui afin de produire cet ouvrage qui représente quatre années de composition. En participant à cette campagne, vous contribuerez à la continuité de ma carrière... mais vous m'aiderez aussi à la porter à l'autre bout du monde!
Ce nouvel album sera en effet suivi d'une tournée de l'hémisphère austral qui débutera en Nouvelle-Calédonie, une petite île française nichée entre l'Australie et la Nouvelle-Zélande que j'ai découverte cette année grâce à mon frère Marc, qui travaillait là-bas. C'est là que j'ai achevé de composer les pièces de L'insulaire. 

L'insulaire... Curieux que j'ai choisi ce titre pour désigner une île, celle de Montréal, alors que c'est une île située aux antipodes qui en deviendrait l'ultime inspiration.



Cette lointaine partie du monde s'est ouverte à moi, m'a ouvert les yeux et le coeur comme seule mon Abitibi natale avait su le faire jusque là. Elle m'a redonné goût à la vie à un moment où j'avais envie de baisser les bras. Porté par cette vague, j'entends poursuivre mon aventure artistique en partageant avec vous mes récits et ma vision musicale. 


Encore une fois pour cet album, j'ai su m'entourer d'une merveilleuse équipe : 



Aux commandes de l'enregistrement, mon collègue guitariste JJ Coolidge, réalisateur du très admiré Forward, le troisième album d'Erik Mongrain. 



Ma chère amie, l'artiste graphiste de talent Geneviève Baril, créera la pochette de L'insulaire.




Léa Deborde, ma complice avec qui je prépare en ce moment la tournée du Pacifique, mais qui est aussi ma photographe ainsi que la conceptrice du site Internet ( www.justinst-pierre.com ) 


Oui, la vie est remplie de surprises. Et souvent elle sait placer les bonnes personnes sur notre route.


Vous avez envie de m'aider à concrétiser ce projet? Merci, et bienvenue dans cette belle aventure!



Voici un extrait réalisé en préproduction de Promontoire, qui sera selon moi une des pièces maîtresses de l'album :


https://soundcloud.com/justinstpierre/promontoire-excerpt




Les fonds amassés lors de cette campagne serviront à défrayer les coûts d'enregistrement, de mastering, de graphisme et de duplication de l'album. Ils serviront aussi à réaliser des vidéos promotionelles et à financer mon départ pour le Pacifique Sud!






Si cette campagne dépasse l'objectif fixé (ce qui me ferait carrément halluciner!!), j'utiliserai les fonds supplémentaires pour enregistrer un album de reprises. Les fans qui m'ont vu en spectacle et qui suivent ma carrière depuis des années m'ont souvent dit qu'ils aimeraient entendre ma voix sur disque. Quel plaisir ce serait pour moi d'exaucer ce voeu en leur offrant un album de chansons!






L'insulaire sera produit au cours de l'été 2015. Le départ pour le "Pacific Tour" est prévu pour octobre 2015, les destinations visées étant l'Australie, la Nouvelle-Zélande, la Thaïlande et le Japon. Et après? Qui sait? Tout est possible!
Toutes les personnes qui contribueront à cette campagne seront tenues informées du déroulement de l'enregistrement, et elles auront aussi accès à des extraits vidéo de mes nouvelles compositions. 

L'âme de cet album sera sans contredit ma nouvelle guitare, ''The Arrow'', un instrument exceptionnel fabriqué par un des plus grands luthiers de notre époque, Sheldon Schwartz. Cette guitare fera résonner ma musique comme jamais. 




N'hésitez pas à partager ce projet sur Facebook, Twitter et sur les autres réseaux sociaux. 
Et parlez-en à vos amis, parce que le bouche à oreille, ça fonctionne!

Merci de votre attention, de vos encouragements et de votre désir d'embarquer dans cette aventure qui représente la continuité de ma carrière. 

Je vous en serai à jamais reconnaissant.

-English-
Hi there,
My name is Justin
St-Pierre, I am a Quebec fingerstyle guitarist and composer who has two albums
to his credit: Rafiot (2008), and La Faille (2011). In addition to touring
regularly, I’ve won several music competitions, including the prestigious
international competition of the Canadian Guitar Festival in 2013.
I am now ready to record
my third album, L’insulaire, a French
word which means “the islander”, and so I am seeking your support in this, my
very first Indiegogo campaign.
The pieces on this album
were inspired by the urban soundscapes of the island of Montreal, the rumblings
of the city, the boisterous buzz of its inhabitants. It expresses the elation,
the joy, but also the solitude I felt, all filtered through the prism of a
rapturous six-string mantra.
While my previous albums
were self-financed, this time I feel compelled to let you in on the production
of this collection of works which span four years of composition. Your contribution
will push my career forward, and help me take it to the ends of the earth! Let
me explain.
Once the recording of L’insulaire is completed, I will embark
on a tour of the Southern Hemisphere that will kick off in New Caledonia, a
country that I had the pleasure of discovering this year thanks to my brother
Marc, who was working there. It is on this small French island of the South
Pacific, nestled between Australia and New Zealand, that I put the finishing
touches to the acoustic guitar pieces you will find on this album.
L’insulaire,
The Islander... This title now seems strangely appropriate considering the
project’s first notes resonated on one island, that of Montreal, but found
their ultimate inspiration straight across the world on another.
This remote part of the
world opened up to me, opened my eyes and my heart like no place before it,
safe from my native Abitibi. It put colour back into my life at a time when all
had gone grey, lifted me and gave new breath to my musical vision. I am now ready
to share this wonderful adventure with you.
Again this time, I have
an incredible team to help me out:
L’insulaire
will be engineered and produced by JJ Coolidge, who also did production duties
on Erik Mongrain’s third album, Forward.
The sleeve and artwork
of the album will be created by my dear friend, the graphic artist Geneviève
Baril.
My cherished accomplice,
Léa Deborde, is taking care of the logistics for the Pacific Tour. She is also
my official photographer, as well as the designer of the website ( www.justinst-pierre.com ) 
No doubt, life is full
of surprises. And it has a way of putting the right people across our path.
Feel like helping me see this project to fruition? Thank
you. Hope you enjoy the ride!

Here’s a sample of a
piece called Promontoire (Promontory), recorded by JJ in preproduction. It’s shaping up to be one of the
album’s high points:
https://soundcloud.com/justinstpierre/promontoire-excerpt
The funds collected on this campaign will finance recording,
mastering, graphic design, and CD duplication. They will also enable me to
produce promo videos, as well as help me reach the South Pacific!

If this campaign exceeds
its target goal (which, frankly, would totally blow me away!!), I’ll use the additional funds to record a
collection of cover songs. The fans who have followed my career and seen me
live have often told me how they would love to hear me sing on an album. What a
thrill it would be for me to grant them this wish!
L’insulaire
will be recorded this summer. The Pacific Tour is set to start in October, with
projected dates in Australia, New Zealand, Thailand, and Japan. After that, who
knows? We’ll see where the wind takes us!
As a Justin St-Pierre
contributor, you will get regular updates during the recording. I definitely
want you to know how things are going! You will also have exclusive access to
videos of me playing excerpts of my new compositions.
My new guitar, “The
Arrow”, will undoubtedly be the heart and soul of L’insulaire. Built by one of the greatest luthiers of our time,
Sheldon Schwartz, this exceptional instrument will make my music soar like
never before.
Don’t hesitate to share
this project on Facebook, Twitter, and on other social media.
And tell your friends!
Word-of-mouth is still the best form of communication.
Thank you for your time,
for your support, and for helping me take my career and my artistic vision to a
higher plane.
For this, I will be
forever grateful.


 

Justin St-Pierre

story:
ABOUT US: 

Hey y'all! I'm Carri Smithey! I am a singer/songwriter from Burlington (Ossipee), NC. I have been writing songs since I was 15, with one main focus...my own personal sanity :).  Everyone deals with their life, goals and passions differently, and for me; music has always been my outlet.  I was raised in a musical family; music was always in the air.  Talk about inspiring!

I want to give back with my music and make a difference to those who hear and most importantly support me.  

I am now singing with an amazing group of musicians who are not only great guys to play with, but in time have become some of my close friends. 

We came together in January 2015, after The Ends offered to be my band, and to say the very least I was ecstatic! Our first day playing together was to record a demo for the Chris Austin Songwriters Competition held at Merlefest. We place'd 3rd out of 600+  artists!!! 

We have since been writing and performing live together, anticipating this debut album! 

THE GOAL! 

Record My Debut Album!

We have some amazing new songs we want to share with ya'll (and some old ones too), but we just can't do it alone.  For as long as I can remember I have wanted to share my music with folks, but never had the guts to just go for it.  

So here is my HAIL MARY!

The only way I can make my dream come true is help from all of y'all! 

HOW YOU CAN HELP:

We are looking to raise $5000 to record and press our debut full length album. 

Any contribution you could make is very much appreciated! Even if you can't donate, just take a moment to SHARE the info in the chance that someone you know could donate.  I understand the magnitude of $5000, but for the first time ever, I have some musicians that truly from the bottom of their souls believe in my music, and in me.  It has really pushed me to be a better singer-songwriter, and I'm so thankful for their support and encouragement.  They want my songs to stay true to me and how I write them; so that everyone will be able to hear MY sound.

We will be rewarding donation with special perks. See "Perks" for rewards. 


The Band:

-Carri Smithey- Vox/Guitar

-Josh G. King- Vox/Guitar 

-Keith Ingalls- Guitar/Vox

-Ryan Burgess- Drums/Vox

-Josh Coe- Bass

story:
I K E  H A R M O N


"THESE MANSIONS MADE OF SKY" 


12-SONG CD MUSIC PROJECT 

SLATED FOR JUNE 2016 RELEASE


I EVIDENTLY WAS BORN A SINGER-SONGWRITER. I HAVE NO OTHER WAY TO ACCOUNT FOR THE MUSIC THAT HAS PLAYED NON-STOP IN MY SOUL SINCE THE DAY I WAS BORN. I LOVE MELODY AND I LOVE LANGUAGE. I LOVE TO SING. IT IS WHAT I DO BEST. 

I WROTE MY FIRST SONG WHEN I WAS 12 AND HAVE WRITTEN HUNDREDS SINCE. MY BIGGEST INFLUENCES HAVE BEEN BROADWAY MUSICALS, PUCCINI, THE BEATLES, ROY ORBISON, SIMON AND GARFUNKEL, ELTON JOHN, CAT STEVENS, BRUCE COCKBURN, ETTA JAMES, TONY BENNETT, TOM PETTY, BOB DYLAN, AND THE GREAT AMERICAN SONGBOOK. 

AT 19, I WAS SIGNED AS A SINGER-SONGWRITER BY THE SEATTLE PRODUCER OF "LOUIE, LOUIE" - JERRY DENNON. I HAVE SINCE RECORDED A NUMBER OF SONGS, BUT THE BEST SONGS I'VE WRITTEN HAVE BEEN BORN DURING THE LAST 5 YEARS. I AM PASSIONATE THAT THESE SONGS DESERVE TO RECORDED AT THE HIGHEST POSSIBLE QUALITY AND MADE AVAILABLE AS A COMPLETED WORK OF GREAT MUSICAL DEPTH AND THEMATIC INTENSITY. 

ASSISTING ME IN BRINGING THESE SONGS TO VIBRANT LIFE ARE: 

BASSIST AND MULTI-INSTRUMENTALIST, BEN RAFAEL MCQUILLIN; 

DRUMMER EXTRAORDINAIRE, EMORY MIEDEMA-BOJAJIAN; 

AUDIO ENGINEER, JEFF WOOLLEN; 

AND A NUMBER OF FABULOUSLY TALENTED VASHON ISLAND MUSICIANS, INCLUDING LEAD GUITARIST, LUKE MCQUILLIN; STAND-UP BASSIST, STEPHEN MEYER; SAXMAN, JAMES FERRARI; TRUMPETER, BARRETT COOPER; GUITARIST, RICK DAHMS; AND OTHERS STILL TO COME.

ONE SONG - "I USED TO BE A LOVER" - HAS ALREADY BEEN RECORDED AND CAN BE HEARD ON VASHON RADIO STATION KVSH 101.9FM, AS WELL AS ON THE WEB AT WWW.VOICEOFVASHON. ORG. 

I WELCOME ALL MY CONTRIBUTORS TO PROVIDE THE INSPIRATION AND WHEREWITHAL TO CREATE A TRULY REMARKABLE MUSICAL TESTAMENT TO LOVE, HOPE, AND DESIRE. I BELIEVE IN THE UNIQUE ABILITY OF ROCK'N'ROLL TO BRING GREAT EXPRESSIVE POWER TO THE WORLD WE LIVE IN AND A SHARED HOPE CAPABLE OF SUSTAINING OURSELVES AND OUR COMMUNITIES.

PLEASE JOIN WITH ME AND MY TEAM AS WE ATTEMPT TO CREATE A UNIQUELY POWERFUL AND BEAUTIFUL AND UNFORGETTABLE WORK OF MUSICAL ART!!!

What We Need & What You Get

THE COSTS OF THIS PROJECT INCLUDE: $7,500 FOR RECORDING STUDIO, SOUND ENGINEER AND POST-PRODUCTION AND TO REALIZE THE FULL POTENTIAL OF EACH AND EVERY SONG; $1,500 FOR CD PRESSING AND PACKAGING; $500 FOR VIDEO RECORDING AND PRODUCTION; $600 FOR CD MASTERING; $1,200 TO COVER TE COST OF CREATING AND MAILING THE REWARDS FOR THE CAMPAIGN; AND $600 IN TRANSACTION FEES TO INDIEGOGO FOR CREDIT CARD TRANSACTIONS.  TOTAL COST OF PRODUCING "THESE MANSIONS MADE OF SKY" IS $11,900.

PLEASE HELP US REACH THIS GOAL. WITH YOUR FULL SUPPORT THIS MUSICAL PROJECT WILL BE COMPLETED TO THE HIGHEST LEVELS WE ARE CAPABLE OF AND MADE READY FOR RELEASE NEXT SPRING 2016.  JOIN WITH US IN THIS MUSICAL ENDEAVOR AND HELP US TO MAKE PACIFIC NORTHWEST MUSICAL HISTORY! 

The Impact

THE MUSIC INDUSTRY HAS CHANGED DRAMATICALLY OVER THE YEARS. MOVING THE DELIVERY OF SO MUCH OF THE WORLD'S MUSIC TO THE INTERNET HAS TRANSFORMED RECORDED MUSIC. FOR BETTER, AND FOR WORSE.

AT THE SAME TIME, MUCH OF WHAT WAS GOOD ABOUT THE TRADITIONAL WAY OF RECORDING AND DISTRIBUTING MUSIC WAS THAT THERE WERE CULTURAL CUSTODIANS AND KNOWLEDGEABLE ENTHUSIASTS THAT HELPED MAKE KNOWN AND DISTRIBUTE TRULY WORTHWHILE FORMS OF MUSIC: RECORD PRODUCERS, DJS, REVIEWERS, REGIONAL PROMOTERS, AND OTHERS. 

SO WHILE SO MUCH MUSIC IS JUST A CLICK AWAY, IT ALSO TRUE THAT WHAT GREAT MUSIC THERE IS CAN BE BURIED BEYOND REACH IN THE SHEER MAGNITUDE OF WHAT IS AVAILABLE.

"THESE MANSIONS MADE OF SKY" IS AN AMBITIOUS WORK BASED ON ORIGINAL SONGS OF VERY HIGH EXPRESSIVE AND MUSICAL QUALITY.

THIS PROJECT REPRESENTS THE OPPORTUNITY TO PRODUCE A WORK OF ART COMMUNALLY WITHOUT COMPROMISE AND WITH AS MUCH ARTISTIC INTEGRITY AND ABILITY WE CAN MUSTER.

Risks & Challenges

THE CREATIVE PROCESS IS NEVER EASY. IT IS ALWAYS A HUGE CHALLENGE TO FIND SOMETHING OF VALUE IN ONE'S OWN LIFE AND EXPERIENCE AND ATTEMPT TO SHARE IT WITH OTHERS IN A TRULY MEANINGFUL WAY. 

I BELIEVE THAT MUSIC IS THE SINGLE MOST POWERFUL FORCE HUMAN BEINGS HAVE TO FIND AND CELEBRATE OUR SHARED EXISTENCE. OUR WORLD AND OUR PLANET IS STRESSED BEYOND BELIEF AND ONLY THOSE WITH A PROFOUND FAITH IN PEOPLE WILL BE ABLE TO ESTABLISH THE COMMON BONDS NEEDED TO PRESERVE THE BEAUTIES OF CREATION. GREAT SOULFUL AND TRUE MUSIC IS THE SALVATION OF US ALL. 

AS A PERSON AND AS A MUSICIAN, I VALUE LOVE AND COLLABORATION ABOVE ALL OTHER THINGS. I BELIEVE I HAVE THE COURAGE, VISION, AND TENACITY TO CREATE A BEAUTIFUL WORK OF MUSICAL ART THAT WILL BE VALUED BY MANY THOUSANDS OF PEOPLE AS IT BECOMES KNOWN OVER TIME. I BELIEVE IT WILL ENDURE.

THE MAIN CHALLENGES ARE TO STAY TRUE TO THE MUSICAL VISION AND TO KEEP INTACT A HIGH LEVEL OF INTEGRITY THAT WILL MASTER THE HURDLES AHEAD.

"WE ALL HOPE THERE IS SOMETHING BEYOND WITHIN, A SONG OF THE SPIRIT ABOUT TO BEGIN."

- OPENING VERSE: "INTO THE INFINITE" - CONCLUDING SONG: "THESE MANSIONS MADE OF SKY" WRITTEN BY IKE HARMON. 2-YEAR OLD VIDEO AVAILABLE ON YOU-TUBE ("INTO THE INFINITE IKE HARMON").

Other Ways You Can Help

IF YOU ARE UNABLE TO CONTRIBUTE FINANCIALLY, PLEASE, DON'T LET THAT STOP YOU FROM CONTACTING ME. I WOULD LOVE TO TALK TO YOU ABOUT ANY CONTRIBUTION YOU WOULD LIKE TO MAKE IN HELPING BRING "THESE MANSIONS MADE OF SKY" TO THE WORLD.

story:
Why Is This Important?

Each culture and community has its own stories. Through telling these stories, we build bridges between communities based on the understanding we share. In performing these two chamber operas on Indian themes, Festival Opera hopes to bring the unique cultural experience of the Indian community to those outside it, connecting the wide variety of cultures and communities in the Bay Area via opera.

The double bill: Gustav Holst's Savitri and Jack Perla and Chitra Divakaruni's River of Light, provides two different insights into Indian culture, the former being based on the episode of Savitri and Satyavan from the Mahabharata, a Sanskrit epic of ancient India and the latter being a contemporary look into what it means to be an assimilated American yet still desire to maintain ties with your cultural and family heritage. The vision for presenting these works highlights how opera as a genre can not only link cultures, but also tell stories that are timeless and relevant.

Who We Are

Now in our third decade, Festival Opera remains committed to bringing professional opera productions at affordable prices to residents of San Francisco's East Bay communities. The third-largest opera company in the Bay Area, Festival Opera is a showcase for talented young artists and directors.

Where Is The Money Going?

The money earned from this campaign will be used to pay the cast, musicians, and artistic team for their contributions. This includes the singers, traditional Indian dancers, and orchestra members who dedicate a majority of their time to learning and performing the music as well as the director and designers for translating what is on paper to the stage. Grants, ticket revenue and individual donations to date reveal a shortfall that we hope to fill with this campaign. If you believe in the importance of telling unique, culturally-relevant stories, won't you please contribute?

Perks

All donations made are tax-deductible, and an acknowledgement letter will be sent. Donations of $100 and over qualify you as a member of Festival Opera, giving you the benefits of voting membership at Festival Opera's Annual Meeting and advance subscription order privileges. Being a member also grants you invitations to special events throughout the year.
A full list of benefits per donation level can be found at http://festivalopera.org/benefits.php

Risks & Challenges

Due to the fact that funds raised will pay artists' fees, there are no risks involved. All funds will be applied for that purpose.

How You Can Support Us

In addition to supporting Festival Opera's Indian cultural chamber operas via this campaign, you can purchase tickets to a performance, and invite others to purchase tickets and donate to the campaign. Festival Opera is a community-based regional opera company, and would not exist without your patronage and support. Thank you for helping us share these stories.

Donations can also be made directly to Festival Opera at http://festivalopera.org/donations.php
Buy tickets for "Savitri" and "River of Light" chamber operas

story:
Short Summary

Passion pursuit is a non-profit organization that raises money to provide concert and event experiences and lessons for low-income families. 13% of kids in Canada grow up in these circumstances, it can be hard for parents to afford some really great opportunities to help their children grow. We believe that every child should have those opportunities regardless of circumstance because kids involved in sports and music are less likely to use substances and commit crimes. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is  $10,000! We want to make a big impact in our community. The closer we get to our goal, the more opportunities we can give to kids. 

$200 will go into starting up our website and submitting the appropriate paperwork. 

$9,800 will be distributed between buying blocks of lessons, tickets to concerts and starting up a small scholarship fund. 

Donations of $30 or more include Passion Pursuit swag. Earbuds, t-shirts and bluetooth speakers.

Risks & Challenges

We have an experienced team that has worked on international projects (Golden Future, Oxfam, CANFAR) and local causes (Run for the Cure, U of Alberta Musician's club). We are prepared for any hurdles that we may come across because we feel so passionate about inspiring young people by helping them with their passions. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our page to raise awareness about our cause. Thank you!

story:
Let's Imagine

When we first started playing together last summer, we planned to make an album so that our kids would have an easy way to remember and enjoy the songs we made up when they were little. But after the album came out, song ideas just kept coming to us, and more and more people seemed to be enjoying our music all around the world, from Minneapolis to Australia.

Now we have more than 25 new songs, and we want to share at least a dozen on a second album - but we need your help. Recording music is expensive, and Dan's 40th birthday (for which he gifted himself our last recording studio session) only comes once every few years. We need your help to get back in the studio and produce a second album, one that isn't just for our kids, but for you and your kids, too.

We're calling the second album "Let's Imagine" after a song we wrote (and not after Alfonzo Blackwell's similarly titled, soft-jazz album), but we think it's a good way to describe what we do in general. We use music to inspire our listeners' imaginations, and to inspire our own imaginations. 

What We Need & What You Get

We're planning to start recording in a home studio this summer, which will save us some money. But to finish recording in a studio - and to pay to get the album professionally mixed and mastered, not to mention album art, and CD printing - we need your support. If the first album was any indication, the second album will cost a bit more than $6,000. We're hoping all of our friends, family, and fans will pitch in by the end of the summer so we can get this album recorded, produced, and out by early December - just in time for the holidays!

If you were likely to buy a CD or listen to us on Spotify, then we're just asking you to pitch in sooner rather than later. And there are so many other great rewards to get on top of a digital download or CD. You can get a sheet of limited edition stickers and t-shirts designed by the fabulous David Huyck, a live, command performance of one of our songs via Facetime or Skype, a personalized voicemail greeting (like this one or this one), a ringtone, a fresh song on a topic of your choice - and you can schedule a private house concert!

Timeline

Home studio recording is slated to start during the last week of July, but we can only record certain parts on our personal equipment. To handle the rest, if we raise enough money by the beginning of August, we'll head to The Library - where we recorded album #1. There, we'll make use of recording engineer Matt Patrick's extensive library of musical instruments (Hammond organ, three different accordions, industrial-sized glockenspiel, a panoply of hand percussion), and we'll bring in a few musical guests to record cameos, including Ken Pierce of "Hot Dog" fame.

If all goes according to schedule and if you pre-ordered an album through this campaign, you'll receive your digital download or physical CD by early December. Stickers and t-shirts will arrive with your CD. And if you commission a performance, a voicemail greeting, ringtone, or song, or book a house concert, we'll be in touch about scheduling.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you choose not to take advantage of the opportunity to snag an advance copy of the second album or claim any of the awesome perks we're offering, we hope you'll share this campaign (and our first album) with anyone you think might enjoy our music. We hope our music is meaningful and enjoyable to parents and kids alike, and nothing would make us happier than to have our songs spread far and wide.

THANK YOU!!!

story:
We need your help to get to Womex!

 

Cairo Concepts is a music series that features Mahraganat artists and experimental producers from Egypt and abroad like

  • Alaa 50
  • Belya El Karnak
  • DJ Haram
  • DJ Plead
  • 3Phaz
  • Nustaliga
  • Tor5y
  • Listen to the latest release here!

 

Some of the artists been selected to play a special showcase in front of club bookers from all over Europe at this years World Music Expo (Womex, Finland)! This is a major step in bringing Mahraganat to a wider audience. Help us impact the global club scene with some of Egypt's most interesting artists!

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

We're heading over with Alaa 50, Belya El Karnak, 3Phaz & Phil Battiekh. All we need now are 4000$ to get them there. Your contributions will help cover flights, boarding costs and visa fees. You get some awesome perks in return, like:

  • A discounted digital download of the Cairo Concepts release
  • A 3d-printed Cairo Concepts necklace
  • A cameo in the next video clip (you need a cell phone camera for that one)
  • A Mahragan song written about you on the next release
  • A hand-signed watermelon
  • ...and many more!

 

The Impact

 

Mahraganat has been on the rise in Egypt and worldwide since it was first created ten years ago. For the first time ever, a delegation of Mahraganat artists have been specifically invited to play in front of an audience of club bookers, music agencies and other music industry tastemakers.

This is a huge chance for the entire genre and could potentially lead to more booking opportunites for many more Mahraganat artists and, ultimately, awesome new soundscapes worldwide!

Help us reach our goal of getting Cairo Concepts to Womex!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

If you want to help but can't afford it, please spread this campaign on your social media :)

story:
Andrew Rebel hails from Santa Margarita CA, a small railroad town surrounded by ranch land. He has been touring and playing in bands since he was a teenager, but is just now stepping out on his own as an independent artist. For years he has been gifting his talents to other songwriters, making their songs come to life. Finally now, he has a debut EP of his own songs, fully recorded, mixed and mastered, and ready to be released. Your pre-orders and other contributions will make it happen! 

Your pre-orders and contributions will help fund the pressing, duplication, and distribution of CDs and vinyls for Andrew Rebel’s debut EP, “Wildfire.” With every pre-order or contribution you will receive a digital download of the single, title track “Wildfire” before the release date, and a full digital download of the complete, seven track EP when it is released.

If a campaign goal of $500 or more is met, CDs will be sent to contributors.

If a campaign goal of $1,500 or more is met, vinyl records will be sent to contributors.

If a campaign goal of $2,000 or more is met, t-shirts, hats, and other merchandise will be sent to contributors. 

Other perks include: signed merchandise, handwritten lyric sheets, and even live performances!

Pre-order and contribute today, and be a part of Andrew Rebel’s music from the very beginning!

Spread the word and share this Indiegogo campaign with your friends and family!

story:
Short Summary

Help Stella Splendens complete and release our first e.p.! Preorder the e.p. here, and get unique gifts made by the members of the band that won't be available elsewhere!

We've already recorded the songs, at the amazing PULP Arts is Gainesville, FL. Your support will help us to mix, master, and print CDs. In return, all supporters at every level receive a digital download. And if you can afford to donate at the higher tiers, you'll get beautiful risograph prints by the band, who are all visual artists as well, as well as other neato gifts.

story:
Foreign Exchange

 

We at Ever Evolved are excited to announce that we will be partnering with Art After Dark for a music and art showcase overseas in Europe on May 22nd, 2020, in Vienna, Austria. We will be bringing the majority of our artists and staff but we need your help in getting there! In order to accomplish our goal we will need to raise approximately $15,000 USD. The fundraising will go directly to flights, lodging and food for the artists and staff.

 

This is important to us because it is a big step in our journey to becoming successful artists within a charitable and influential collective in Chicago. Since Ever Evolveds inception about 5 years ago we have helped dozens if not hundreds of talented individuals on their path to becoming successful independent creators. From musical artists, merchants and visual artists, we have helped put them to work through one of our many events and connected them to an audience and network that helps them grow. We have given away hours upon hours of free studio time, graphic designing and time on stages in and out of Chicago. We have taught and helped sharpen the art and technique of stage performing and song building for artists new to the industry. We have helped give voice to creatives without a platform.

 

With 102 shows in our pockets and counting, 52 in 2019 alone, throughout Chicago, surrounding suburbs, Los Angeles, New York, Michigan, Minnesota, Nebraska, Missouri, Oklahoma and more. 642 articles promoting the work of Chicago artists and counting, and countless hours night and day recording, producing, and mastering the creations for dozens if not hundreds of artists. We feel we have only started on our journey to success in becoming Chicago’s #1 one stop shop for artists and right now is the perfect time to take our efforts to the next level. With your help, we may continue to expand our collective operation in 2020 to bring a bigger and more effective platform for local artists by connecting with networks throughout the states and around the world. Through your donations and effort of our own we can and will reach our goal; to get to Europe, build our network and throw an amazing music and art showcase.

 

To help you help us we will be curating many events throughout Chicago leading up to our show in Europe this May. We will have showcases, battles, open mics, and parties! All of these events will be geared toward funding our trip to Europe. Come out to a few and experience the community oriented music culture that is Ever Evolved! Now, here is where you can help us and make a difference personally. Our events will not be able to cover the costs of our trip entirely, needing to pay event staff, DJ’s, artists, venue and promotional costs. Besides live events, we need your help by donating to our IndieGoGo campaign! And there are many perks and benefits once you decide to help us out!

 

All of us at Ever Evolved would like to thank you for your support over the years and with your continued help in this vision of getting our collective of artists to play in Europe, come to life.

story:
You know---I was always waiting for the day when I could just "self-fund this thing!" Well, that was really just an excuse so that I didn't have to overcome pride and fear. No more. Your help on this project will be immense and for it I am already incredibly grateful. I have two boys and if there's anything I impart to them, I want them to know that they can chase their burning dream--no matter what...and that it's okay to ask for help if you need it to make your dream happen. 

This has been a goal of mine for awhile. I feel beyond lucky to record at Capitol Studios in L.A. !

I grew up in a tiny town in Northern Idaho. It's pretty much where heaven decided to touch earth. Because of where I grew up, natural beauty has had a profound impact on the music I write. On that note, I may or may not have written a song about it that may or may not appear on this project...

I've been playing and writing music since I was 5. Music was always something I wanted to pursue, but I think we have a tendency to let life and fear get in the way of the things we want to accomplish. 

Well, on January 1st 2019, I decided to face that fear and get serious about making music a priority--whether I 'felt' ready or not.  It's been a crazy ride this year, and I'm super happy to be at the point where I'm ready to share my gifts with you.

This whole project is the Jake Uhlenkott Music Project (theJ.U.M.P.) and the songs on this album are written from some pretty dark places, but there's an overarching theme of hope. My goal with my music is to help people heal. Music touches us in ways that nothing else can. It's such a privilege to share mine with you :)

The budget to complete this debut album is $20,000. This ensures that the collaborators are compensated, as well as covering the recording, mixing, mastering, and marketing of the music. (wow, that's a lot of m's!)

It is such an honor and an unexpected opportunity to record at a place like Capitol...I am so thankful for your support as we this opportunity into reality.

Love,

 

AMDG 2019+

story:
Buffalo Jones - Who We Are:

Hello!  We're Buffalo Jones, an independent alternative rock and roll outfit from Spokane, Washington.  We've been playing here in the Inland Northwest and far beyond for well over a decade now - since 2006, in fact - and our latest adventure will take us to Athens, Georgia. 

We released our first album in the fall of 2008, and have put out two subsequent releases, but this one is different.  You see, over the years, we've been fortunate enough to tour with and open for some amazing national acts - guys that we idolized as younger musicians cutting our own teeth.  That list includes bands like Cracker and Camper Van Beethoven, both of which are fronted by David Lowery.  

After developing a friendship with Mr. Lowery and co. on the road, he was gracious enough to offer to produce our next album for us.  As we said in the overview, when that kind of opportunity knocks, you answer the door.

We've set up all of the details and are ready with a whole batch of new material.  Now, all we need is some help to cover the costs.  By pre-ordering or donating even more to this project, you'll get some amazing, one-of-a-kind perks, and you'll help us to record an album with one of our biggest influences.

Here are the Perks!

As we mentioned, we've booked Chase Park Transduction, a studio in Athens, GA for the last two weeks of August.  Chase Park is where bands like REM, Queens of the Stone Age, and Cracker have recorded some of their best albums.  We've also hired Drew Vandenberg, who has engineered on a lot of our favorite records.  Neither of those things is cheap, nor is getting from Spokane, Washington to Athens.  We need a total of $8,000 to cover the cost of transportation and production of the album.   Here are some of the perks we'll be offering those who want to support us with a pre-order or more!

  • For only $20, you'll get a deluxe digital download of the album with demos and other unreleased material.
  • For only $5 more, you get signed physical CD, and a sticker, too!
  • At the $50 level, you'll get all of the above plus a T-shirt, and $75 will get you our full digital catalog, and a signed poster.
  • We've got a bunch of shows this summer.  $100 buys you the right to write the setlist.
  • For $250, you'll get a private acoustic house-concert from either Jason Johnson, Andy Rumsey, or Brandon Humphreys for as many of your friends as you can cram in your house. $500 will get you the whole band! (100-mile radius from Spokane, WA).
  • Finally, if you're willing to invest $1000, we'll pull out all of the stops:  A full-band show at your house, yes, but we're not stopping there. Our drummer, Joshua Martin, is a culinary instructor and a hell of a chef.  Prior to the show, he'll cater a gourmet meal for you and nine of your closest friends! (Talk to us for travel radius details)

If our total goal is not reached, all proceeds will still go toward paying for the new album.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't swing a pre-order?  No worries, we could still use your support:

  • By spreading the word on social media - PLEASE SHARE!
  • Come see us live this summer and bring your friends!

Thanks so much for your support!

-Buffalo Jones

Come see us live this summer and bring your friends!

Thanks so much for your support!-Buffalo Jones

story:
Ultrafaux and Hot Club of Baltimore collectively have recorded 6 critically acclaimed albums since 2012  including 34 original songs, featuring over 20 musicians.  We’re gearing up for our 7th and 8th releases, working with some incredible musicians, but we need your help in order to pull it off!

Everyone who donates will get a download.  

Those who donate $100 or more will receive a surprise bonus gift and a CD when we make them.  (For now its just digital downloads.)  

Those who contribute $500 or more will receive honorable mention on the liner notes of both projects.  Thanks for helping us achieve our goal.   

The final product of our efforts will be two albums:

#1. Ultrafaux Ensemble Tangent  A provocative album of my original songs performed by a larger ensemble featuring exceptional musicians I've toured with and met over the years. This won't be your typical album that stays in one musical style. The songs will move freely between styles while remaining rooted in Gypsy Jazz.  Instrumentation includes violin, accordion, clarinet, guitar, bass, mandolin, and oud to create a wide palette of sound for the listener.  

#2. Hot Club of Baltimore Best of Hot Club  At least 4 new songs recorded by Hot Club of Baltimore featuring vocalist Alexis Tantau and special guest violinist Evan Price and 6 "Best of" songs from our past three CDs, all totally remixed and remastered. The recording will feature tight arrangements and a full ensemble of horns, guitars, bass, vocals violin and piano.  I can also tell you we will be recording some very unique songs nobody has ever done in the Gypsy jazz style. 

The official pre-release date is set for Charm City Django Jazzfest 2020 on February 21 & 22 in Baltimore Maryland, followed by an official release date in March with shows all over the world scheduled throughout 2020. Your generous donation allows us to take the first crucial steps toward our goal!  

Players featured include Jason Anick (Boston), Patrick McAvinue (Nashville), Giacomo Smith (London), Dallas Vietty (NYC), Connor Stewart (NOLA), Jonathan Greene (NY), Evan Price (San Francisco) plus other NY and Nashville based players along with Baltimore-based players Sami Arefin and Zach Serleth.     

The Goal: To record at least 10 new original compositions and take this music on tour all over the world and to release two quality albums that truly represent the best of what we can do.   

A lot of planning and cost is involved coordinating players from various regions, lining up studio time, mixing, mastering, and creating a PR plan for promotion and touring. I have created a thorough spreadsheet of all the costs involved; everything from studio-time to transportation, production costs, and artist fees.  A lot of the musicians I'm working with really believe in this project already, so having their enthusiasm and encouragement has been HUGE.  

Thanks for checking out this project and considering donating.  Its my best work yet as a musician and I am excited to share it with you!  

In gratitude - Michael Joseph Harris

story:
Hello, beautiful people!

 

All of us in Project Locrea would like to invite you to be part of the process of creating our first album.

We would like to express our gratitude to everyone who has supported us since the group's first concert two and a half years ago - THANK YOU, ALL!

To all of you who are just discovering us - WELCOME! Looking forward to sharing this creation process with you!

Who we are

We are a world music ensemble that brings together musicians from different cultural and music genre backgrounds. Our music draws inspiration from the folk songs of our home countries, as well as jazz, chamber music and modern styles like pop, rock and hip-hop. The instrumentation you would see and hear at our live shows is a mix of traditional and modern instruments and it will often vary from one concert to another. 

The Name

Locrea is a combination of the first syllables of the words Lo-ve and Crea-tivity.  

Project Locrea's Story

The group was formed in 2018 by founder and flutist Yana Nikol. The instrumentation at the time included flute, Chinese dulcimer, Azeri tar, guitar, bass and drums. Since then the Project Locrea family has expanded and welcomed many new members and new instruments - a Peruvian pipes' player, Bulgarian kaval player and Ethiopian vocalist. We are always ready to welcome new members to the family and expand the ensemble and the instrumentation. 

The Album

There will be 9 songs on the album. Some of them will be original compositions, some will be arrangements of folk songs. All compositions and arrangements are created by Yana Nikol and Cristian Perez who are also members of the band. Our sound engineer is Dave Kline. Here is a list of the musicians who will be on the album with their country of origin and instrument:

Yana Nikol - flute, vocals (Bulgaria)

Cristian Perez - guitar (Argentina)

Chao Tian - Chinese dulcimer (China)

Munit Mesfin - vocals (Ethiopia)

Juan Cayrampoma - Peruvian pipes (Peru)

Manny Arciniega - percussion (Texas, US)

Marty Risemberg - drums (Virginia, US)

Benjamin Rikhoff - bass (Maryland, US)

The Funds

Your beautiful money will go towards funding the recording process, mixing and mastering, album cover design, physical copies, licensing fees (for some of the arrangements), marketing and album release concert. If we go over, we'll also make a video or two! :)

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word - help us share this campaign with as many people as possible. This will be incredibly helpful especially in the challenging COVID times. 

Give us a like - we are Project Locrea on all social platforms. Facebook, Instagram, Youtube - join us everywhere or somewhere! 

Subscribe - to our email list. That way you will receive updates about the album process and also find out when and where will be our next concert. 

 

Thank you for your care and thank you for your support!

LOVE TO YOU ALL,

PROJECT LOCREA

story:
BeatMower: Roaring 20s Album

Nat Keefe here. You might know me from the bluegrass outfit Hot Buttered Rum, where I play guitar and sing. For the last couple years I've also been doing solo DJ sets as BeatMower, and just released BeatMower’s premiere singles “Kwishima” and “Universe.” I’m now asking my wider circles to support me in creating BeatMower’s first full length album and music video. 

I’m making an original album combining sounds from East & West Africa with the sounds of Bluegrass music. This will continue the adventure BeatMower began last year in Rwanda and Zambia, with a quarantine stopover in Dubai, Shelter-in-Place in San Francisco, and living room dance parties everywhere. 

In February-March 2020 I journeyed with Hot Buttered Rum to Rwanda and Zambia. The supporters of an earlier Indiegogo campaign generously provided me with proper recording equipment, and, after performance days with Butter, I collaborated with and recorded several Rwandan and Zambian musicians to create “Kwishima” and “Universe.” 

March 2020 was, of course, right when the Covid Pandemic was beginning to turn the world upside down. In Lusaka, Zambia, I decided to end my trip two days early and head home to my wife and small kids. Quite unfortunately, I registered a slight fever before boarding my connecting flight in Dubai. I was urgently whisked away to the tarmac, where an ambulance awaited me. I ended up spending 5 days in a (rather nice) hospital in Dubai, under guard, before a negative Covid test cleared me to leave. 

I returned home on March 19, 2020, to a home completely changed. San Francisco on shelter-in-place lockdown! Work and schools closed! Every gig on the horizon canceled. 

My impulse was to play music. I began weekly Saturday night shelter-in-place livestream sets, and BeatMower sounds bounced around living room dance parties across the globe. My partner Erin would come hang and dance and we’d connect with friends far away. For us and others, this was bliss after so much time in lockdown. 

This year, I’m asking my people to support me in going deeper.  If we can reach full funding of this album, we’ll be able to make something grand, with all kinds of people. I’ve got a vision! My skill set is assembled. My supporting cast is assembled.  I’m calling on my music friends in Rwanda, Zambia, and Ghana to record parts for me. I’m calling on my music friends in America to record parts for me.  As these sounds come into the mix, I’m doing a series of small scale, Covid-safe shows to test things out. Maybe one of these will be in your backyard? As the world re-opens, my hope is for BeatMower to be the personal soundtrack to your Roaring 20s. I’m here to serve. 

This is an album to make now. The very nature of BeatMower music lends itself to long-distance collaboration. There is so much pent-up energy in my friends and family and fans… When the time comes, I’m ready to celebrate with you.

Thanks for your support! And if you’re not in a place to contribute financially but still want to be involved, please be in touch. 

Best,

Nat
